title: Trainee Technician (Engine MRO)
company_info: Pratt & Whitney is a world leader in the design, manufacture and service of aircraft engines, and auxiliary power units. It offers a broad product portfolio that includes commercial aircraft jet engines, commercial turboprop engines, military aircraft engines, business and general aviation jet and turboprop engines, helicopter turboshaft engines. Pratt & Whitney in Singapore is a global center of excellence with the most comprehensive service offering outside of the U.S. Located in key industrial areas of Loyang, Seletar and Tuas, the Pratt & Whitney companies operating in Singapore include: Component Aerospace Singapore, Eagle Services Asia, P&W NGPF Manufacturing Company Singapore, Pratt & Whitney Canada (SEA), Pratt & Whitney Component Solutions, and Turbine Overhaul Services. Pratt & Whitney has been operating in Singapore for more than 30 years, making it one of the pioneers in the development of Singapore’s world-class aerospace industry.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Overview
The Trainee Technician programme aims to equip you with the required skillset and knowledge to become an Aircraft Engine Technician. You will undergo a 12-month comprehensive theory and practical training program, leading to the grant of an authorization or approval certificate. Upon completion of the trainee programme, you will be equipped to perform maintenance, repair, and overhaul of aircraft engines. High performers will have the opportunities to become Certifying Technicians or explore other opportunities in Pratt & Whitney.
Responsibilities
Utilize machines/ equipment/ tools to carry out disassembly, assembly and inspect functions of engines, its associated modules, parts, components or accessories.
Read and execute the standard operating procedures (SOP).
Solve technical issues and problems as appropriate when encounter in their daily work.
Assist the Cell Leaders / Assistant Foremen / Workshop Engineers in their daily operations to achieve production targets, corporate goals, and discipline.
Carry out SAP transaction and make necessary changes to works order in SAP.
Carry out proper documentation.
Actively support and participate in EHS and Continuous Improvement and Ethics culture projects and any other corporate initiatives.
Carry out any other duties as assigned.
Requirements
NITEC, Higher NITEC, or Diploma in Mechanical / Electrical Engineering or other related engineering disciplines.
Fresh graduates who are keen to pursue aerospace industry are welcome.
Good understanding of technical drawing.
A curious and learning mindset – we provide on-the-job trainings and certifications.
Self-motivated to work independently with a positive attitude towards change management.
Good team player with strong communication and interpersonal skills.
Good working knowledge of MS Office applications.
Commit to work on rotating shifts (Day & Night) and overtime on need basis.
Why Join Us
We drive innovation to go beyond with a purpose to transform aviation.
We grow our people to become leaders with talent & leadership programs.
We offer employee scholarship program for further education.
We care for your well-being with comprehensive health, medical & dental benefits.
We provide company transport from Pasir Ris MRT station.
We provide structured on-the-job trainings and in-house/ external certifications.
We value trust, safety, integrity, respect, safety, innovation and excellence.
We provide annual wage supplement (AWS) and variable bonus plan.
We provide shift & meal allowances (Shift work only).
We provide overtime benefits as applicable (Shift work only).
Our ethos is “We Succeed, Together”.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Audio Visual Project Engineer
Working days: Monday - Friday
Working hours: 9am - 6pm
Salary range: $2800 - $4000
Location: Kallang Bahru (Near Bendemeer MRT)

The Audio Visual Project Engineer will be responsible for overseeing the design, installation, and maintenance of audio visual systems for various projects. The Engineer will work closely with project managers, technicians, and clients to ensure that all audio visual systems are implemented to meet project requirements and specifications. The Engineer will also be responsible for testing and troubleshooting audio visual systems, as well as providing technical support to clients as needed.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Collaborate with project managers to determine project requirements and specifications for audio visual systems.
Design and develop audio visual system schematics, floor plans, and wiring diagrams.
Oversee installation of audio visual systems, including equipment placement, cabling, and integration with other systems.
Ensure that all audio visual systems meet industry standards and project requirements.
Test and troubleshoot audio visual systems to identify and resolve any issues.
Provide technical support to clients, including training on system operation and maintenance.
Create and maintain project documentation, including system manuals, as-built drawings, and testing reports.
Work with technicians to schedule and perform regular system maintenance, including firmware updates, software upgrades, and hardware replacements.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, technologies, and best practices for audio visual system design and installation.
Brief project updates and status to project managers and clients as needed.
Qualifications:
Possess with Electrical Engineering, Audio Engineering, or related education background.
Experience in audio visual system design, installation, and maintenance.
Knowledge of audio visual system components, including video projectors, sound systems, video walls, and control systems.
Familiarity with audio visual system design software, such as AutoCAD or Visio.
Ability to read and interpret technical drawings and schematics.
Willingness to travel to project sites as needed.

title: Quality Control Quality Assurance Engineer
company_info: Accesstech is a rapidly expanding group of companies with interest in Engineering Construction, Telecommunications and Investments. Founded in 1998 in Singapore with our principal business in high-tech factory engineering, we have since extended our expertise into commercial projects with luxury hotels and commercial properties. Quality, Educations and Environmental Health and Safety are foremost values in the company. Accesstech is ISO 9001, ISO 14000 and OHSAS 18001 certified. Our Integrated Management Systems promised the simplicity of delivery and assurance of our performance. Click here to find out more. PEOPLE are the basis of a company potential. The fundamental success of a company will very much rely on its team of workforce. The company now seeks to secure further mid-and senior level leadership and functional support positions. We are seeking independent individuals who have the passion and drive to join our growing family. Remuneration will commensurate with your education level and working experience. We invite you to send in your CV (cover letter with a detailed resume) in MS Word format and email us at career@accesstech.com.sg stating the job function in the email title. Please include your current and expected salary and your availability in your CV for us to conduct a more effective job matching. We regret that only shortlisted candidates will be notified. All applications will be held in strict confidence.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Accesstech is a rapidly expanding group of companies with interest in Engineering Construction, Telecommunications and Investments.
Founded in 1998 in Singapore with our principal business in high-tech factory engineering, we have since extended our expertise into commercial projects with luxury hotels and commercial properties.
The Project team is currently looking for a suitable candidate to join us as a Project Engineers (Mechanical) to drive the ongoing and new projects in the company.

Duties & Responsibilities:
Prepare Quality Assurance and Quality Control plans
Assess the systems and controls that organisation has put in place
Provide methods to carry out quality assurance and quality control procedures
Plan for inspections at different phases of the project
Propose continuous improvement initiatives to improve quality management system
Draft inspection checklists
Conduct inspections to ensure that materials used comply with relevant quality assurance requirements and regulatory guidelines
Conduct site surveillance to adhere to quality control procedures
Evaluate if corrective actions taken are accurate and implemented effectively
Apply organisational environmental sustainability and green building standards and guidelines during inspections
Plan preventative maintenance.
Work with others to detect problems and implement solutions.
Maintaining quality and safety standards are upheld.
Site preparation and co-ordination, preparation of submission documents.
Coordinate, liaise and manage various project stakeholders including customers, consultants, sub-contractors, vendors, etc. on site to ensure project requirements are met.
Able to communicate effective to all stakeholders.
Prepare and create detail work schedule, manpower and resource planning.
Coordinate the safety management system on site.
Follow up and reporting on the project progress.
Able to understand Singapore standards or Code of Practice.
All other ad-hoc tasks as assigned by reporting manager.
Work location: Loyang, Joo Koon, Woodlands
Qualifications & Experience:
Relevant Qualification in Mechanical/ Electrical Engineering or equivalent.
For experience candidates, preferably to possess minimum 2 years relevant experience in the Construction Industrial Engineering industry.
Outgoing with strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Ability to work independently and target oriented in a fast-paced environment.
Strong knowledge of civil, structural, architectural or mechanical, electrical, and plumbing disciplines, codes, and regulations
Ability to interact effectively with project members and managers at all levels.

title: Sales Executive Engineer
company_info: THE INVENTION THAT CHANGED THE WORLD In 1902, Willis Carrier solved one of mankind’s most elusive challenges by controlling the indoor environment through modern air conditioning. His invention enabled countless industries, promoting global productivity, health and personal comfort. Today, Carrier innovations are found across the globe and in virtually every facet of daily life. We create comfortable and productive environments, regardless of the climate. We safeguard the global food supply by preserving the quality and freshness of food and beverages. We ensure health and well-being by enabling the proper transport and delivery of vital medical supplies under exacting conditions. We provide solutions, services and education to lead the green building movement. These mark just a handful of the ways that Carrier works to make the world a better place to live, work and play. NATURAL LEADERSHIP From the very beginning, Carrier has been a natural leader. Not simply for the fact that we created an entirely new and innovative product, but because as we did so, we set the standard in environmental responsibility. Since 1994, we have led the industry in the phase-out of ozone-depleting refrigerants while introducing many of the world’s most energy-efficient heating, air-conditioning and refrigeration systems. Preservation of the environment and protecting our world’s finite natural resources is a central tenet of our business. We recognize the vital importance of maintaining a responsible balance between the comfort we create today and the world we live in tomorrow.
job_category: Consulting, Customer Service, Engineering, Logistics / Supply Chain, Manufacturing
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Build a career with confidence
Carrier Global Corporation, global leader in intelligent climate and energy solutions is committed to creating solutions that matter for people and our planet for generations to come. From the beginning, we've led in inventing new technologies and entirely new industries. Today, we continue to lead because we have a world-class, diverse workforce that puts the customer at the center of everything we do.
About the role
Entry-level inside sales professional with sales performance goals. Completes inside sales support and ensure the dicipline's functions are completed effectively. Increase manpower resources to assist the team due to increase orders and sales secured. Primarily role is to support on Post-Sales in achieving on time clean order to factory. Secondary role is to support on Pre-Sales in small values quotation.
Key Responsibilities:
As a Sales Executive Engineer, you’ll be responsible for:
Responsible for success equipment delivery to customer on time and within budget by monitoring internal/external process progress, coordinating activities, and resolving problems.
Prepare equipment submissions and liaise with customers on approvals and prepare ordering instructions accordingly.
Collaborate with peers in other department to ensure customer service support and service technical support are provided to customer in time.
Visit customers and attend jobsite meetings regularly to foster and maintain excellent working relationships.
Coordinate with design team for equipment selection to participate in quotations to customer
Perform any other duties directed by the Manager
Requirements
We are looking for people who are in post-sales coordination. If this is you, get in touch.
As a minimum you must have:
Bachelor’s or Diploma of HVAC/Mechanical/Electrical Engineering, or other building services related discipline required
Minimum 2 years of sales/project experience working in the B2B building industry is preferred
Any certificate relates to Jobsite safety would be an added advantage
Ability to work independently and as part of a team
Confident, Proactive, Optimistic ’can do attitude’
Ability to handle customers and suppliers
Excellent written and effective communication skills
Proven organizational skills and planning ability
Technical understanding
Documentation skills
Proficient in MS Office Suite of tools, AutoCAD, SAP
Benefits
We are committed to offering competitive benefits programs for all of our employees, and enhancing our programs when necessary.
Our commitment to you
Our greatest assets are the expertise, creativity and passion of our employees. We strive to provide a great place to work that attracts, develops and retains the best talent, promotes employee engagement, fosters teamwork and ultimately drives innovation for the benefit of our customers. We strive to create an environment where you feel that you belong, with diversity and inclusion as the engine to growth and innovation. We develop and deploy best-in-class programs and practices, providing enriching career opportunities, listening to employee feedback and always challenging ourselves to do better. This is The Carrier Way.
Join us and make a difference.
Apply Now!

title: Software Engineer (SRE - Platform Services) - Infrastructure Engineering
company_info: Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content. ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About ByteDance
Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of ByteDance's purpose. Our products are built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make our innovations possible. Together, we inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how ambiguous, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At ByteDance, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the users we serve. Join us.

About the Team
The Datacenter Infrastructure Engineering team supports the company's fast growth by building and operating hyperscale datacenters. The team manages the end to end lifecycle of server fleet, providing cloud solutions and various infrastructure services ensuring that they are scalable and are reliable.

Responsibilities
• Engage in and improve the whole lifecycle of services from inception and design, through deployment, operation and refinement.
• Support services before they go live through activities such as capacity planning and launch reviews.
• Support and maintain services by measuring and monitoring availability, latency and overall system health.
• Scale systems sustainably through mechanisms like automation, and evolve systems by pushing for changes that improve reliability and velocity.
• Research, design, and develop computer and network software or specialised utility programs.
• Analyse user needs and develop software solutions, applying principles and techniques of computer science, engineering, and mathematical analysis.
• Update software, enhances existing software capabilities, and develops and direct software testing and validation procedures.
• Work with computer hardware engineers to integrate hardware and software systems and develop specifications and performance requirements.

Qualifications
• At least a Bachelor’s degree in any of these faculties: Computer Science, Information Technology, Programming & Systems Analysis, Science (Computer Studies)
• Experience in one or more programming languages such as Go, Java, C++, Python etc.
• Good problem-solving, analytical thinking capabilities and exceptional attention to details.
• Good communication and collaboration skills.

Preferred qualifications:
• Master's degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering or related areas.
• Expertise in designing, analyzing, and troubleshooting large-scale distributed systems.
• Ability to debug, optimize code, and automate routine tasks.
• Proficiency working with algorithms, data structures and production troubleshooting.
• Expertise in problem solving and analyzing global scale distributed systems.
• Systematic problem-solving approach, coupled with effective communication skills and a sense of drive.



ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Roles & Responsibilities
About ByteDance
Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

To us, every challenge, no matter how ambiguous, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At ByteDance, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the users we serve. Join us.

About the Team
Our Traffic Infrastructure Engineering team build and operate hyper-scale datacenters, manage the life cycle of server fleet, allocate cloud/edge resources and create various cloud/edge solutions, and provide infrastructure services including widely distributed Content Distribution Networks (CDNs).
The team build and leverage various platforms to manage and interact with our infrastructures and services. To support the fast growth and improve operation efficiency, these platforms need to be feature rich, easy to use, scalable, agile and compliant to with policies and procedures.

Responsibilities

title: Software Engineer (Kubernetes Edge Platform) - Infrastructure Engineering
company_info: Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About Bytedance
Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of ByteDance's purpose. Our products are built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make our innovations possible. Together, we inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how ambiguous, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At ByteDance, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the users we serve. Join us.

About the Team
To support the content platform, ByteDance's infrastructure team is seeking experienced software engineers to build globally distributed edge platform for provisioning and deploying edge services. Our team operates a large network of POPs around the world that we use to accelerate site traffic and cache CDN content, on top of which we build the edge platform (PaaS) to allow edge services to be easily deployed around the world close to end users. We use Kubernetes to orchestrate various services with automatic deployment and scaling in order to maximize efficiency in daily management and operations. In addition, our team builds global and local load balancers, acceleration proxies, RPC frameworks, content delivery networks, and the automation machinery to operate an internet scale edge network and handle all of ByteDance's DNS and HTTP traffics.

Responsibilities:
• Build Kubernetes-based edge platform (PaaS) with cutting-edge Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF) technologies.
• Design pipelines and develop microservices for platform monitoring, alerting, logging, CI/CD, etc.
• Improve Kubernetes system efficiency in networking, storage, scheduling domains.
• Collaborate with open-source communities to advance edge computing technology.
• Research, design, and develop computer and network software or specialised utility programs.
• Analyse user needs and develop software solutions, applying principles and techniques of computer science, engineering, and mathematical analysis.
• Update software, enhances existing software capabilities, and develops and direct software testing and validation procedures.
• Work with computer hardware engineers to integrate hardware and software systems and develop specifications and performance requirements.

Qualifications
• At least a Bachelor’s degree in any of these faculties: Computer Science, Information Technology, Programming & Systems Analysis, Science (Computer Studies) with minimum 5 years of work experience
• Solid understanding in Kubernetes and Docker technology: production experience of creating and administrating Kubernetes based systems.
• Experience with microservices, API design (REST and gRPC), and cloud-native application development.
• 5+ years experience with one or more programming languages including Go, Python, JavaScript, and C++.
• 5+ years experience working on Unix/Linux based platforms.

Preferred Qualifications:
• Master’s degree in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or related major
• Experience in using and/or contributing to open-source projects in Kubernetes ecosystem, e.g. Kubespray, Helm, Istio, Prometheus, Envoy, OpenTracing, KubeEdge, etc.
• Experience with Kubernetes networks (e.g. CNI deployment and troubleshooting).
• Experience with Kubernetes API, Operator, and Custom Resource Definition (CRD) development.
• Experience with Kubernetes cross-cluster federation.
• Experience with CI/CD design and development.
• Experience in adapting large-scale distributed systems such as CDN/DNS onto Kubernetes.


ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About ByteDance
Founded in 2012, ByteDance's mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. With a suite of more than a dozen products, including TikTok, Helo, and Resso, as well as platforms specific to the China market, including Toutiao, Douyin, and Xigua, ByteDance has made it easier and more fun for people to connect with, consume, and create content.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of ByteDance's purpose. Our products are built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make our innovations possible. Together, we inspire creativity and enrich life - a mission we aim towards achieving every day. To us, every challenge, no matter how ambiguous, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At ByteDance, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the users we serve. Join us.

About the Team
Our infrastructure team operates a large network of POPs around the world hosting edge services, such as traffic acceleration, CDN cache, gaming, etc. We are seeking experienced reliability/performance engineers to maintain stability and to optimize the performance of various edge services and products running on top of our Kubernetes-based platform (PaaS), and to create solutions for ever growing business needs on the edge.

Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) combines software and systems engineering to build and run large-scale, massively distributed infrastructures. Our SREs are tasked with ensuring the infrastructure services are reliable, fault-tolerant, efficiently scalable and cost-effective. You will have the opportunity to manage a variety of complex systems at scale, including systems that administer hyperscale datacenters and public cloud, global content distribution networks (CDNs) and load balancers that handle Tbps of traffic. You will also have the opportunity to collaborate with various teams to translate business needs into concrete action items, and/or improvements in system design or procedures.

Responsibilities
• Build metrics, tools, automations, visualizations and monitors to facilitate the operation and optimization of edge services.
• Build insights through statistical analysis to help drive targeted deployments to expand the coverage of our global infrastructure.
• Analyze, design and implement solutions at the system level to remove bottlenecks and improve edge service performance.
• Work in a fast-paced environment. Participate in technical operations and rotations in response to performance and reliability issues.
• Research, design, and develop computer and network software or specialised utility programs.
• Analyse user needs and develop software solutions, applying principles and techniques of computer science, engineering, and mathematical analysis.
• Update software, enhances existing software capabilities, and develops and direct software testing and validation procedures.
• Work with computer hardware engineers to integrate hardware and software systems and develop specifications and
performance requirements.

Qualifications
• At least a Bachelor’s degree in any of these faculties: Computer Science, Information Technology, Programming & Systems Analysis, Science (Computer Studies)
• 5+ years experience working with Unix Linux systems from kernel to shell and beyond with experience working with system libraries, file systems, and client-server protocols.
• 5+ years experience in one or more programming languages such as Java, C++, Go, or scripting experience in Shell and Python.

Preferred qualifications
• Master’s degree with 5+ years of experience in Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or related major
• Self-driven and capable of coping with ambiguity and moving projects from concept to delivery.
• Strong analytical skills and the ability to solve real world problems in a fast moving environment.
• Experience in designing, analyzing and building automation and tools for large scale systems
• Experience in building solutions with AWS, Google, Azures and other cloud services.
• Experience in networking technologies such TCP/IP, BGP, DNS, etc. in a carrier-grade environment.
• Experience in developing and operating one or more of following systems: OpenStack, Kubernetes, Nginx, ipvs, ELK stack, Hadoop, etc.

ByteDance is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At ByteDance, our mission is to inspire creativity and enrich life. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

company_info: MTC CONSULTING is a Recruitment and HR consulting firm that serves leading businesses and organizations across various industries. We provide total recruitment and staffing solutions, offering comprehensive scope of human resource services which include: Executive Search Permanent Placement Contract Placement Talent Acquisition Foreign Worker Placement Bulk/Mass Hiring Projects Work Pass Application Services Payroll Services We recruit Professionals, Managers, Executives(PMEs), skilled, semi-skilled as well as blue collars workers across a diverse range of industries. At MTC staffing, we are also expert in placing qualified administrative, accounts, customer service, human resource personnel, production workers etc. At MTC Staffing, everything we do is guided by our values – an unwavering commitment to always do the right things for our clients, our candidates and our people.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our client is a renowned food manufacturing company known for producing a diverse range of high-quality, delicious food products. From fresh bakery items like bread and pastries to a variety of frozen and packaged goods. Their production plant located in the West of Singapore is now looking for a Engineering Manager responsible in managing the whole maintenance team as well as to lead major plant improvement projects.

➤ Basic $6500 - $8000 + AWS + Variable Bonus
➤ 5 Days (Office Hours) - Clementi area


Responsibilities
Lead a team of engineering supervisors and shift engineers to diagnose mechanical and electrical breakdowns, assessing the best course of action and conducting a root cause investigation to eliminate the likelihood of re- occurrence.
Project lead for all installations, overhaul of equipment and plant, working with suppliers to ensure they deliver on time, on budget and with minimum disruption
Lead the implementation of a factory wide PM system using the current Process Control System, and ensuring PM activity is carried out during factory downtime at the correct frequency to an agreed standard.
Effective manage an Engineering team including performance management, training and development
Ensure that all projects are engineered to scope, budget and relevant standard and regulatory compliance.
Fulfilling a key role within part of the site management team, being fully accountable and reporting on assets and ancillary plant downtime across site.
Lead all on site preventative maintenance activities.
Budgetary management/control, responsibility for the day to day management of the site repair and maintenance budgets
Implement safe systems work and managing 3rd party site engineering works, liaising with the operations team to ensure that plant critical repairs minimize plant disruption or managed out of hours.
Upholding GMP engineering standards across site, 3rd party technical customer audits & statutory inspections are passed any non-conformances are closed out with root cause analysis to avoid repeat failure.
Continuous improvement of engineering ways of working to ensure improved equipment performance. A six sigma qualification would be desirable but not essential however knowledge of continuous tools and techniques is essential
Lead the implementation of autonomous maintenance deployment process across the site.
Responsible for maintaining and improvement of all engineering assets and developing an asset care strategy
Setup an effective Engineering planning function, leading the development of Job Libraries and codifying repair

Requirements
Degree in Mechanical or Electrical Engineering
Minimum 7 year's management experience in engineering, project and maintenance management within food manufacturing industry.
Demonstrates understanding of project management and engineering from a technical and operational point of view
Strong analytical, problem-solving and decision-making skills
Excellent planning, organizational skills and sense of urgency
Background of hands-on experiences from new line installation project and/or focus improvement project will be advantageous


For consideration, kindly submit your CV by clicking “APPLY Now”
**Only shortlisted candidate would be notified**
EA Reg. No: R1873990 | Lucky Lee Ding Cong

title: Senior Controls Support Engineer
company_info: VANDERLANDE INDUSTRIES SINGAPORE PTE. LTD. Vanderlande is the global market leader in baggage handling systems for airports. Vanderlande’s baggage handling systems move 3.7 billion pieces of luggage around the world per year. Established in 1949, Vanderlande has more than 5,000 employees, and a consistently increasing turnover of more than 1.1 billion euros. Changi Airport Group (CAG) has selected Vanderlande as the baggage handling supplier for the Terminal 1 Redevelopment project at Singapore Changi Airport, and we are, therefore, looking for new team members! Multiple vacancies are available. https://careers.vanderlande.com/careers https://www.vanderlande.com/news/vanderlande-secures-baggage-handling-contract-with-changi-airport-group
address: PAYA LEBAR SQUARE, 60 PAYA LEBAR ROAD 409051
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Controls Support Engineer (LLC)
Job Description
Are you our upcoming technical service expert? Do you like to take an extra step, analyzing the root cause of a failed component, and provide solutions for the cause?
Vanderlande understands the complexities associated with a successful airport and parcel operation and delivers future proof logistic process automation. These automation systems are composed of many (electro-) mechanical, IT and controls components that require expert knowledge to support.
As a Controls Support Engineer you have a strong affinity with Operational Technology (OT) software like PLC’s and PC based controllers and the electromechanical components they control such as conveyors, sorters and shuttles.
As Controls Support Engineer , you will analyze and assist in servicing baggage handling system controls software. You are responsible for helping the operation and maintenance team find and resolve system issues, researching solutions, and proposing changes to the system. You will have frequent contacts with customers, internal organization, and suppliers.
Your tasks and responsibilities:
As Controls Support Engineer you report to the Maintenance Manager. Based on your field of interest there is opportunity to grow to a specialized or manager role within the service or project execution department.
Your department:
The Changi Operation and Maintenance Team is part of the APAC Lifecycle Services (LCS) in the Business unit Airport & Parcel Solutions (APS) within Vanderlande Industries. The primary task is to support Changi T1.
The department works in an international team setting with people from different countries with different cultural backgrounds.
Key Responsibilities:
As Controls Support Engineer, you will be a primary point of contact for the customer, so it’s important to have good communication skills. Taking ownership is your core value.
Analyze problems by asking the right questions, you listen to the customer, and you translate your findings into a technical solution.
Have a systematic way of troubleshooting a problem top-down or bottom-up, whichever is required.
Think in cause-effect advising the customer on the next cause of action minimizing downtime for the operation.
Take pro-active measures based on own insight, lifecycle plans or preventive maintenance plans.
Develop, modify, and maintain PLC programs for baggage handling system control and monitoring.
Perform routine maintenance, troubleshooting, and diagnostics of control systems to ensure optimal performance.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate control systems with other baggage handling components.
Monitor the system for anomalies, alarms, and faults, and respond promptly to resolve issues.
Evaluate and implement system upgrades, improvements, and modifications to enhance performance and safety.
Maintain accurate records of PLC programs, control system configurations and maintenance activities.
Ensure compliance with safety regulations and standards in all control system operations.
Provide training and guidance to maintenance and operational staff on control system operation and troubleshooting.
Be available for on-call duty to respond to critical system failures and emergencies outside of regular working hours.
Please note that this role requires a rotating 8-hour shift structure, which may include day, evening, and occasional night shifts (for project work). Flexibility and the ability to adapt to changing shift schedules are essential for success in this position.
Your Profile:
You are an analytical problem solver who can easily bridge the physical and software world. You have a systematic way of troubleshooting. You like to work together in an international multi-disciplinary team of engineers.
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in electrical engineering, Automation, Instrumentation or a related field.
Preferably you have good understanding of IT service management practices (ITIL v3/v4)
Minimum of 5 years of experience in PLC programming and control systems within the baggage handling or airport industry.
Experience with Siemens controls programming, software and hardware
Proficiency in PLC programming languages (Ladder Logic, Structured Text, etc.).
Basic knowledge of OT Software development and maintenance
Strong knowledge of control system hardware, including PLCs, HMIs, SCADA, etc.
Familiarity with relevant industry standards and Safety regulations.
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure.
Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively in a team environment.
Good communication skills in English
Assertive team player and proactive
Willingness to work in a 24/7 operational environment and be on-call as needed

title: Site Engineer / Supervisor (Electrical and Instrumentation)
company_info: ABOUT SEMBCORP INDUSTRIES (Company registration: 199802418D) Sembcorp Industries (Sembcorp) is a leading energy and urban solutions provider, driven by its purpose to do good and play its part in building a sustainable future. Headquartered in Singapore, Sembcorp leverages its sector expertise and global track record to deliver innovative solutions that support the energy transition and sustainable development. By focusing on growing its Renewables and Integrated Urban Solutions businesses, it aims to transform its portfolio towards a greener future and be a leading provider of sustainable solutions. Sembcorp has a balanced energy portfolio of 16.7GW, with 9.8GW[1] of gross renewable energy capacity comprising solar, wind and energy storage globally*. The company also has a proven track record of transforming raw land into sustainable urban developments, with a project portfolio spanning over 12,000hectares across Asia. Sembcorp is listed on the main board of the Singapore Exchange. It is a constituent stock of the Straits Times Index and sustainability indices including the FTSE4Good Index and the iEdge SG ESG indices. For more information, please visit www.sembcorp.com. [1] Including acquisitions pending completion
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Purpose and Scope
Direct report to the Project Manager, work, responsible as a site engineer or site supervisor, who is also a Sembcorp Competent Person (SCP) to manage and supervise site works and ensure all aspects of the site works are aligned with the project schedule, scope of work and obligations as required under the Contract.
Key Roles and Responsibilities
Support the Project Manager on monitoring the site works progress and when necessary to expedite the site works progress to meet the project schedule
Responsible as a Sembcorp Competent Person (SCP) to apply for and receive Permit To Work (PTW) and is qualified to supervise the execution of the work.
To check, review and enforce Contractor’s site works are inline with the scope of works and update the Project Manager daily on the site works progress.
To ensure the Permit-to-Work (PTW) are applied in advance as per Sembcorp HSE requirements and the PTW to be issued expeditiously by O&M team for the Contractor to commence their work
Work closely with the relevant parties to ensure approval of document prior to site work such as Method Statement and Risk Assessment (MSRA), PTW application etc, to ensure the document is reviewed, amended, discussed and agreed with all relevant stakeholders including the O&M team.
During construction, to review and provide input to RFI or engineering deliverables such as drawing, ITP etc for any corrective actions required
Work closely with the QA/QC engineer(s) to enforce the quality of works at site and are aligned with the QA/QC quality plan and other documentation such as blowing/Purging/Cleaning procedures, hydrostatic testing procedures, etc.
To ensure the site work is compliance to applicable company codes & standards, safety practices, QA/QC policies and meeting performance specification during the Site Acceptance Testing (SAT), commissioning and testing.
Any other necessary duty as assigned.
Qualifications & Experience
Diploma or Degree in respective discipline Engineering (process, chemical, electrical, mechanical, piping, Control & Instrumentation or Civil &Structural), project management, or equivalent tertiary education
At least 5-10 years of experience in petrochemical or refineries, process plant, power utilities, or water industries in projects management environment. Familiar with EPC working environment in Singapore.
Attended and passed examination of WSQ Supervise Workplace Safety and Health in Process Plant (previously known as OPISCS) conducted by WDA-ATP or similar, or equivalent industry regconized external course.
Attended courses and/or training including but not limited to
PTW Procedure
Hot Work
Lifting
Excavation
Radiography
Working-at-Height
Confined Space
Lift Saving Role (LSR)
Lock-out-tag-out (LOTO)
Safety Induction Course (SIC)
Skills/competencies & Preferred Characteristics
Posseses good communication (oral) and written skills
Possess at least a Class 3 driving license for adhoc situations would be an advantage as the projects are located in Jurong Island.
Demonstrate critical thinking skill, positive attitute, teamwork, analytical, communication skill, leadership skill.
Can work independently with minimum supervision.
Positive attitude with high self motivation to deliver the outcome
Good stakeholder management skillsPurpose and Scope

Our operations are carried out by a highly experienced international team with a strong passion for engineering excellence. We operate a total of six ISO-certified shipyards - one in Singapore, three in Batam and two in China. Our yards boast wide-ranging capabilities and different specialties, from rig building to shipbuilding, ship repair, drillship re-activation, life-extension, and conversion services. company_info: From its inception in the year 1997 JPL Consultants Pte Ltd has grown steadily, delivering architectural, civil and structural engineering projects of increasing complexity and value in Singapore and major cities around the world. JPL has developed a systematic approach in fulfilling development needs by offering services in civil and structural engineering, project supervision and management, and appraisals to name a few. As the years have gone by, JPL has gotten the reputation of providing receptive and effective, on time, and within budget quality service. We pride ourselves in being able to meet our clients' ever changing needs. Highly motivated and experienced, JPL qualified professionals are skilled and confident to adhere to our clients’ requirement. To cater for our client’s need in China, JPL established a subsidiary office in Shenyang in year 2007. It has grown into sizeable professional practices that not only serves projects in China, but support our HQ’s project when needed. JPL Consultants is dedicated to expanding itself as a major consultancy firm here in Singapore as well as in China, not only in the provision of architecture, civil and structural consultancy services, but also in project management. Our target is to become a competitive agency in the Asian Market. Currently, JPL Consultants service a wide range of clients in Singapore. We involved in projects ranging from media, private housing, industrial, government as well as educational institutions. In celebration of our 10th year in civil engineering consultancy services, JPL Consultants opened our 1st subsidiary in Shenyang, China in 2007. We are extremely pleased that our subsidiary is going strong and have been involved in a number of high profile projects. JPL Consultants have also been involved in a number of big oversea projects such as Dubai International Airport, India Jaipur International Airport and Malaysia Kota Kinabalu Airport. In Singapore, JPL Consultants is currently involved in the IR at Sentosa as well as a number of upgrading works to various army camps across Singapore. We are dedicated to continuing our good work, and hope to provide our expertise to more clients in the near future.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Interested applicants, please apply through this link:
https://hrsembcorp.darwinbox.com/jobs/jobsdetailed/id/a642bda324f312/grp_company/a632dab40df257/custom_source/a63e33a9955939/custom_type/a63e33a612821e

Key Roles and Responsibilities
Design and review of Electrical systems during front end engineering design (FEED) and basic design for centralised utility facilities, utility power and water, petrochemical industries and utility scale renewable projects
Provide technical expertise to develop electrical engineering design deliverables (e.g. SLDs, equipment list, datasheets and specifications)
Review inter-disciplines design/ engineering with consideration for safety, quality, performance, reliability, flexibility of operation with optimal project and life cycle cost
Develop and continually improve internal engineering best practices and procedures to provide engineering services of high quality in support of the various projects
Support Project-In-charge for over-seeing contractors / vendors for on-site electrical works and accountable for updated and accurate records of all electrical systems
Conduct engineering activities during business or project development including but not limited to pre-feasibility/ feasibility studies, technical due diligence, cost estimation, site survey, technical proposal to customer, project / EPC scoping strategy, vendor selection and review, determine LCOE, budgetary quotation review and clarifications, and all related technical support and solutions, etc.
Evaluation of new technology and innovation solutions e.g. competitive alternatives to SF6 insulated GIS, etc.
Attend FAT/SAT and Functional testing to ensure electrical equipment’s are meeting the design intent & project premise
Review and approval of detailed design submitted by Contractors and ensure compliance with Standards and all the company best practices
Establish system and documentation for company engineering standards & specification, ITP, approved vendor/manufacturer list, material specifications, discipline’s schedule of rates and cost estimate template, engineering checklists, etc
Ensure all activities carried out are in full compliance to all regulatory and authority requirement requirement i.e. Energy Market Authority Act, Electricity Act and local Code of Practices during execution of Engineering Design
Ensure engineering support is provided in a timely manner to all stakeholders through resource planning, close collaboration with discipline engineers and team members, contractor management, etc.
Where applicable, provide training and guidance other team members
Qualifications & Experience
Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical engineering discipline or equivalent
At least 5-15 years of experience in energy business related engineering management and project management (engineering and construction)
Experience in power and water utilities as well as renewable energy projects is preferred
Good command of multiple energy resource simulation and and optimisation tools is preferred
Skills/competencies & Preferred Characteristics
Demonstrate critical thinking skill, positive attitude, teamwork, analytical, communication skill, leadership skill
Strong self-motivation and work ethic, flexible and thrives work under pressure
------

Please note: Only fully vaccinated candidates will be considered for the above position.

Remuneration will commensurate with experience and qualifications and only shortlisted candidates will be notified on next steps.

Sembcorp and its approved recruitment consultants do not ask for payment from job applicants at any point in our recruitment process. Communications requesting for such payments are fraudulent. You may refer to our advisory for more details.

For latest news, please follow our LinkedIn page.

title: Research Associate (Computer Science / Electrical Engineering)
company_info: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London. NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N). Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district. Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources. For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg
description:
Roles & Responsibilities

Key Responsibilities:

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are looking to recruit an E & E Engineer who can handle technical matters such as product development till mass production stage. Your role is to provide engineering support to our manufacturing partners to bring new products to market. You will also support production & maintenance matters and troubleshoot product issues from both customer and partner end.
An ideal candidate for this position must have an academic engineer qualification. Familiarity with our industry is a great advantage. For this role, you should be able to work autonomously and assist with a wide range of engineering duties, like liaising with customers, partners and test agencies/laboratories as required.
Responsibilities for Electrical & Electronics Engineer:
Assist in new product development planning & execution. Research and apply new technologies to our products. Understand customer product requirements (through sales department and at times direct customer feedback) Conduct product failure/fault investigation with assistance of our manufacturing partners and/or test laboratories.
Assist with software design, development and maintenance. Carry out hardware and software troubleshooting, debugging and fault rectification both in-house and/or at customer site when required.
Perform quality check and ensuring products meet customers’ requirements and expectations. Prepare documentations required by customers and testing agencies (e.g. test reports and datasheet). Liaise with partners to source and test components for suitability and quality.
Interface and coordinate with test laboratories/agencies as required.
Evaluate the technical feasibility of new product concepts through testing of prototypes, engineering-based calculations and/or simulation. Present new product design concepts to marketing and sales through technical presentations.
Other ad-hoc works assigned by superiors.
Requirements for Electrical & Electronic Engineer:
Candidate must possess at least a Diploma in Engineering (Electrical/Electronic) or equivalent experience with electrical circuit drawing and design. Positive working attitude, willing to learn, ability to cohesively work as a team and improve with new skill sets over time. Ability to manage multiple projects at one time. Good programming knowledge in C/C++, etc. Hands on experience with electrical circuit testing and troubleshooting. Able to work independently. Familiarity with emergency lighting and lighting industry will be an advantage for this position.
Required language(s): English & Mandarin

title: Fleet Engineering Specialist (Mechanical | Electrical) - 2 Year Contract
company_info: We are PSA Marine, a leader in the maritime sector since 1964. From our early days as the Port of Singapore Authority to corporatisation as PSA Marine, we have played a vital role in Singapore’s growth as the world’s busiest container transhipment hub. Over the years, our business portfolio has expanded beyond core businesses – Towage and Pilotage, to marine advisory, ship-to-ship transfer, navigational audit, water supply by waterboat, crew transfer in the offshore wind industry, and training and consultancy services. With our team of 1,800 dedicated employees and modern fleet of more than 70 tugs, we have a presence in Peru, Europe, Bangladesh, China (including Hong Kong and Taiwan), India, Oman, and Southeast Asia today. We are committed to deliver only the best as we continue to be alongside our customers and stakeholders in every leg of their journey. Our commitment to excellence fuels our zeal to innovate and define the future of maritime for the generations ahead.
description:

Perform lathe machining, basic gas welding, and cutting works to facilitate repair to machinery

Perform proper disposal of used oils and chemicals

title: Technical Officer, Electrical Maintenance
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Meranti Power Pte. Ltd., a fully owned subsidiary of Energy Market Authority, is establishing a maintenance team to maintain two open cycle gas turbines of our power generation station.

We are inviting applicants for the positions of Technical Officer (Electrical) who shall report to the Senior Engineer/ Engineer/ (Electrical Maintenance) and be responsible for supporting him in the maintenance of Electrical systems of the power station/plants. The Technical Officer shall support Electrical team in the following:

Responsibilities:

Responsible for proper maintenance of gas turbine, generator and auxiliary systems as assigned by Head or Engineers in-charge
Perform troubleshooting, predictive, preventive and corrective maintenance to ensure plant equipment and systems run smoothly and efficiently
Identify, plan and initiate required actions to maintain the power plants for long term reliability and efficient generation output
Prepare technical specifications for equipment services, contract labour and ad-hoc maintenance services. Supervise and report performance of contractors to ensure good quality and progress of maintenance works, as well as full compliance with contract specifications
Liaise, supervise, and coordinate with contractors and vendors on projects, maintenance, repair, shut down, and overhaul works
Support operation and maintenance engineers in investigation, analyse and determine the root cause of plant defects and outages
Maintain and control all records as required
Assist in the preparation, certification and review of all management systems, including ISO 9001, ISO 14001, ISO 18001, ISO 50001 annually and provide support to the auditing parties wherever necessary, including internal & external auditors, to rectify non compliances and/or to follow up on improvement items identified during audit
Support engineers in managing maintenance contracts and inspections, testing and commissioning of new equipment
Monitor ad-hoc plant projects/tasks to ensure on time delivery
Perform work orders allocated by Department Heads and/or Engineers

Requirements:

Education in Electrical Engineering
Minimum 2 years’ Electrical maintenance experience in a power plant or related industry
Willing to work overtime
Self-driven with good working attitude and possess keen learning disposition
Proven attendance record and works well in a team
Work location is in Jurong Island (Transport to and from Jurong East MRT are provided)

Only shortlisted candidates will be notified.

By submitting your personal data and/or resume to Meranti Power Pte. Ltd. (“MP”), you shall be deemed to have given your consent to MP for collecting, using, and disclosing your personal data for the purpose of assessing your job application.

title: Mechanical Engineer (Contract Basis)
company_info: From its inception in the year 1997 JPL Consultants Pte Ltd has grown steadily, delivering architectural, civil and structural engineering projects of increasing complexity and value in Singapore and major cities around the world. JPL has developed a systematic approach in fulfilling development needs by offering services in civil and structural engineering, project supervision and management, and appraisals to name a few. As the years have gone by, JPL has gotten the reputation of providing receptive and effective, on time, and within budget quality service. We pride ourselves in being able to meet our clients' ever changing needs. Highly motivated and experienced, JPL qualified professionals are skilled and confident to adhere to our clients’ requirement. To cater for our client’s need in China, JPL established a subsidiary office in Shenyang in year 2007. It has grown into sizeable professional practices that not only serves projects in China, but support our HQ’s project when needed. JPL Consultants is dedicated to expanding itself as a major consultancy firm here in Singapore as well as in China, not only in the provision of architecture, civil and structural consultancy services, but also in project management. Our target is to become a competitive agency in the Asian Market. Currently, JPL Consultants service a wide range of clients in Singapore. We involved in projects ranging from media, private housing, industrial, government as well as educational institutions. In celebration of our 10th year in civil engineering consultancy services, JPL Consultants opened our 1st subsidiary in Shenyang, China in 2007. We are extremely pleased that our subsidiary is going strong and have been involved in a number of high profile projects. JPL Consultants have also been involved in a number of big oversea projects such as Dubai International Airport, India Jaipur International Airport and Malaysia Kota Kinabalu Airport. In Singapore, JPL Consultants is currently involved in the IR at Sentosa as well as a number of upgrading works to various army camps across Singapore. We are dedicated to continuing our good work, and hope to provide our expertise to more clients in the near future.

title: Research Fellow (Computer Science / Electrical & Electronic Engineering)
company_info: A research-intensive public university, Nanyang Technological University, Singapore (NTU Singapore) has 33,000 undergraduate and postgraduate students in the Engineering, Business, Science, Humanities, Arts, & Social Sciences, and Graduate colleges. It also has a medical school, the Lee Kong Chian School of Medicine, established jointly with Imperial College London. NTU is also home to world-class autonomous institutes – the National Institute of Education, S Rajaratnam School of International Studies, Earth Observatory of Singapore, and Singapore Centre for Environmental Life Sciences Engineering – and various leading research centres such as the Nanyang Environment & Water Research Institute (NEWRI) and Energy Research Institute @ NTU (ERI@N). Ranked amongst the world’s top universities by QS, NTU has also been named the world’s top young university for the past seven years. The University’s main campus is frequently listed among the Top 15 most beautiful university campuses in the world and has 57 Green Mark-certified (equivalent to LEED-certified) buildings, of which 95% are certified Green Mark Platinum. Apart from its main campus, NTU also has a campus in Novena, Singapore’s healthcare district. Under the NTU Smart Campus vision, the University harnesses the power of digital technology and tech-enabled solutions to support better learning and living experiences, the discovery of new knowledge, and the sustainability of resources. For more information, visit www.ntu.edu.sg

title: RTL Engineer
company_info: Lightelligence, founded in 2017, is the world's leading optical computing company. With its top technology R&D team and experienced engineering team, and through close cooperation with leaders in the semiconductor, cloud computing, finance, autonomous driving industries, Lightelligence has transformed the cutting-edge technology of photonics into groundbreaking computing solutions. These not only bring exponential improvements in computing power, but also dramatically reduce energy consumption. At Lightelligence, our team develops cutting-edge technology at the forefront of photonic computing. With a culture of internal mobility, we offer opportunities to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed. If you are looking to solve one of today’s most complex engineering challenges and see the results of your work to revolutionize computing technology, join us.
address: The Metropolis, 9 N Buona Vista Dr 138588
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Description
At Lightelligence, our team is developing cutting-edge technology at the forefront of photonic computing. With a culture of internal mobility, we offer opportunities to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.
If you are looking to solve one of today’s most complex engineering challenges and see the results of your work to revolutionize computing technology, join us.
What you'll be doing at Lightelligence:
Define, specify, and implement the SoC micro architecture for advanced photonic based AI accelerator to meet the product requirements.
Define, specify, and architect analog IP blocks (plus digital wrappers) and work with analog IP team in making implementation trade-offs.
Define, specify, and architect digital IP blocks and work with digital IP team in making implementation trade-offs.
Technical interface for SW, Systems and Applications teams.
Interface with DFT, Security, Functional Safety and Software teams to ensure SoC architecture meets all product related requirements.
Requirements Core Qualifications
Master degree in Electronics/Electrical Engineering or Computer Science (or equivalent)
10+ years’ experience on SoC architecture, RTL design, SoC integration or related fields
Familiar with ARM/RISC V based SoC Architecture, experienced on boot flow, debug scheme design
Familiar the digital design flow and related tools
Good team player, can collaborate with others in cross-functional teams
Good problem-solving skills and self-motivated
Bonus Qualifications：
Experience with AI accelerator SoC architecture
Experience with one or more of the complicated IP implementations: DDR/PCIe/Video
Experience with advanced low power techniques, UPF is an advantage
Experience with Synthesis, Static Timing Analysis and related tools is an advantage
Knowledge of security concepts with high-level understanding of cryptographic algorithms is an advantage
Good scripting skills is an advantage

title: Physical Design Chip Engineer
company_info: Lightelligence, founded in 2017, is the world's leading optical computing company. With its top technology R&D team and experienced engineering team, and through close cooperation with leaders in the semiconductor, cloud computing, finance, autonomous driving industries, Lightelligence has transformed the cutting-edge technology of photonics into groundbreaking computing solutions. These not only bring exponential improvements in computing power, but also dramatically reduce energy consumption. At Lightelligence, our team develops cutting-edge technology at the forefront of photonic computing. With a culture of internal mobility, we offer opportunities to thrive in a variety of disciplines. address: The Metropolis, 9 9 N Buona Vista Dr 138588
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Description
At Lightelligence, our team is developing cutting-edge technology at the forefront of photonic computing. With a culture of internal mobility, we offer opportunities to thrive in a variety of disciplines. This is a place for dreamers and doers to succeed.
If you are looking to solve one of today’s most complex engineering challenges and see the results of your work to revolutionize computing technology, join us.
What you’ll do at Lightelligence:
Develop a Static Timing Analysis (STA) methodology and flow suitable for multiple clock and power domains.
Work with stakeholders in all disciplines to determine relevant timing collateral such as timing/process corners.
Run full chip signoff timing analysis. Lead the timing convergence effort with the physical design team.
Work with EDA Tool Venders to help resolve any issues with the timing tools.
Work with team members across all disciplines to optimize all physical aspects of the design
Preferred Qualifications:
BS or higher in a relevant discipline such as Electrical Engineering or Computer Engineering with at least 7 years of relevant work experience
Experience with deep sub-micron technologies, at 1GHz or higher clock frequencies
Solid knowledge of STA Methodologies/Flows.
Experience with industry-standard EDA tools with emphasis on Static Timing Analysis
Familiarity with the Cadence tool-suite is a plus
Proficiency in scripting languages (TCL is a plus)

title: MTS Product Development Engineer (Scan)
company_info: AMD (NYSE: AMD) is a semiconductor design innovator leading the next era of vivid digital experiences with its groundbreaking AMD Accelerated Processing Units (APUs) that power a wide range of computing devices. AMD’s server computing products are focused on driving industry-leading cloud computing and virtualization environments. AMD’s superior graphics technologies are found in a variety of solutions ranging from game consoles, PCs to supercomputers. AMD, Singapore is the Singapore Product Development Center (SPDC) for AMD as well as its Asia Pacific regional headquarters for AMD Sales and Marketing. Established in 1984, AMD Singapore is an engineering site leveraging the differentiated engineering expertise and unique eco-system for product bring-up and sample generation enabling timely product launches, higher test cost margins and the quality expectations of our customers. AMD SPDC actively taps into the large talent pool from the region. Today its highly sophisticated and efficient engineering operations environments are equipped with high-end engineering laboratories that support New Product Bring-up, Customer Samples Generation, Device Analysis, Reliability Testing, Surface Mount Board Assembly Evaluations, Packaging Characterization, Platform Validation and Hardware Debug. AMD SPDC strives to recruit and retain the best talent, making it not only a great place to work but also an integral part of the AMD family by continuing to contribute significantly to AMD’s success.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
THE ROLE:
This is a specialized engineering position responsible for Product Engineering program technical planning for next-generation AMD microprocessors. This individual serves as a critical technical point of contact to the business, design, platform validation and product engineering teams. We have competitive benefit packages and an award-winning culture. Join us!

THE PERSON:
You will provide technical supervision or mentoring to junior engineers and influence others as a subject matter expert. A successful candidate is one who can drive technical decisions independently, has accountability for accuracy, reliability and completeness of assignment results critical to the project’s success. This role allows the opportunity to influence technical decisions that have a significant impact on multiple products or the product line.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Collaborate with design, validation, and architecture teams for content coverage, test pattern development, validation, and debugging
Develop test program infrastructure incorporating latest Best-Known methods
Solves sophisticated, novel, and non-recurring problems; initiates significant changes to existing processes/ methods and leads development and implementation
Identify and plan product improvement activities to reduce cost, improve yield and resolve quality issues

PREFERRED EXPERIENCE:
Experience with being responsible for projects or processes of significant technical importance and for results that cross engineering project areas
Experience with scripting languages such as Perl, Ruby, shell script
Proficient in Linux, Unix, or Windows OS
Statistical analysis experience to resolve population mean and outliers
Deep knowledge of computer architecture is preferred

ACADEMIC CREDENTIALS:
Bachelor’s or Master’s in computer engineering or computer science or electrical engineering, or comparable disciplines
Location:
Singapore

title: Design Engineer
company_info: PERSOLKELLY is one of the largest recruitment companies in Asia Pacific providing comprehensive end-to-end workforce solutions to clients. Headquartered in Singapore, the company was established in 2016 and is a joint venture between Kelly Services, Inc. and affiliates of PERSOL HOLDINGS Co. Ltd. Today, PERSOLKELLY operates more than 45 offices across 13 markets including Australia, China, Hong Kong, India, Indonesia, Korea, Malaysia, New Zealand, Philippines, Singapore, Taiwan, Thailand, and Vietnam. For more information, please visit www.persolkelly.com PERSOLKELLY Singapore Pte Ltd | EA License No. 01C4394
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Our client is one of the leader In the oil and gases industry, they are currently hiring an engineer to design monitoring machinery for clients and consumers. This role will required the individual to be proficient in 3D modelling software, AutoCAD, MicroStation and SAP. Also he/she will be required to speak to stakeholders and engage with regional project management.

Location: Lokyang Way
Salary up to $5000

Essential Responsibilities:
As a Cabinet Design Specialist/Technician, you will be responsible for:
• Primarily responsibility is to create electrical control cabinet design with all necessary documentation according to industry and customer requirements.
• Participate in R3 Handover process, Understand Customer RFQ Design Specification, Compliance to customer specifications for Hardware / Cabinets
• Using Eplan, AUTOCAD, MicroStation software to create and revise Project Drawings (System Layout and wiring, Loop drawings)
• Supporting manufacturing related technical questions and independently lead part SAP Creation and Cabinet designing.
• Ensuring expected results in term of quality, execution time, and cost (within control).
• Recommending new design enhancements or modifications to achieve project objectives.
• Supporting Pre-FAT and FAT pre-works and setup, Cabinet pre-inspection, inspection, and activities to ensure quality technical implementation to meet customer design requirements.
• Work closely with internal team such as project engineer, Cabinet engineer and Project management in a cross-functional environment.
Qualifications/Requirements:
To be successful in this role you will:
Be a Graduate Diploma holder with 2-5 years’ experience in Cabinet design Engineering or specialist.
Have good experience in E-plan, AutoCAD and MicroStation software/tools or SAP usage.
Have good written and spoken English, with demonstrated capability to structure and write technical material.
Have prior experience in global project execution and proficient with document layout, formatting, and editing.
Demonstrate excellent communication skills and an ability to build trusting relationships with customers and suppliers.
Demonstrate the ability to quickly learn new products and business areas
Be a self-starter with minimal supervision requirements, proactively taking the initiative to solving problems and ability to work independently and meet deadlines.
Show an analytical approach to problem-solving and be motivated and focused on results.
Possess Team Player, ability to organize and plan effectively with an Analytical mindset.
Mechanical, Electrical engineering or having experience in engineering field are welcome.
Working with international suppliers
Interested candidates may apply through the application system. We regret to inform only Shortlisted candidates will be notified.
PERSOLKELLY Singapore Pte Ltd • RCB No. 200007268E EA License No. 01C4394 • EA Registration No. R21103542 (Ling Kai Jin)

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Audio Visual Project Engineer
Working days: Monday - Friday
Working hours: 9am - 6pm
Salary range: $2800 - $4000
Location: Kallang Bahru (Near Bendemeer MRT)

The Audio Visual Project Engineer will be responsible for overseeing the design, installation, and maintenance of audio visual systems for various projects. The Engineer will work closely with project managers, technicians, and clients to ensure that all audio visual systems are implemented to meet project requirements and specifications. The Engineer will also be responsible for testing and troubleshooting audio visual systems, as well as providing technical support to clients as needed.

Job Duties and Responsibilities:
Collaborate with project managers to determine project requirements and specifications for audio visual systems.
Design and develop audio visual system schematics, floor plans, and wiring diagrams.
Oversee installation of audio visual systems, including equipment placement, cabling, and integration with other systems.
Ensure that all audio visual systems meet industry standards and project requirements.
Test and troubleshoot audio visual systems to identify and resolve any issues.
Provide technical support to clients, including training on system operation and maintenance.
Create and maintain project documentation, including system manuals, as-built drawings, and testing reports.
Work with technicians to schedule and perform regular system maintenance, including firmware updates, software upgrades, and hardware replacements.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, technologies, and best practices for audio visual system design and installation.
Brief project updates and status to project managers and clients as needed.
Qualifications:
Possess with Electrical Engineering, Audio Engineering, or related education background.
Experience in audio visual system design, installation, and maintenance.
Knowledge of audio visual system components, including video projectors, sound systems, video walls, and control systems.
Familiarity with audio visual system design software, such as AutoCAD or Visio.
Ability to read and interpret technical drawings and schematics.
Willingness to travel to project sites as needed.
