title: Mechatronics Engineer
company_info: Conventional testing labs are slow, provide incomplete results, and lack real-time data monitoring. Aprisium offers rapid, on-site continuous detection and monitoring, at a fraction of the cost. Our solutions provide results within 20-60 mins, compared to 3-15 days needed by labs. Setup is easy and customisable by industries – number of devices needed, number of channels per device. Aprisium also provides real-time online monitoring with AI analytics support for proactive decision-making. Our devices cater to batch testing and autonomous continuous monitoring, for liquids, semi-solids and solids, enabling companies to manage contamination.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Want to develop IoT enabled autonomous environmental sensors?

Job Title: Mechatronics Engineer
Location: Singapore
Duration: Fulltime
Hiring Manager: Dr Lars-Henrik Skjolding, CTO

Aprisium Pte. Ltd.

Aprisium’s mission is to transform contamination management by providing innovative solutions that empower industries and communities to effectively measure, monitor and help mitigate contamination risks, safeguarding the environment and public health. By adhering to the principles of advancing technology, environmental stewardship, customer-centric approach, collaborations, and partnerships, we envision a future where contamination risks are proactively managed, ecosystems are protected, and communities thrive in a healthier environment.
Contamination is a global problem and companies are paying huge fines (for example, just one company in the UK paid 91million pounds as fine for causing contamination with their discharges) apart from tarnishing their brands and investor image, but the current method of detection involves collecting and sending samples to labs and awaiting results in 3-15 days, a predominantly post-mortem exercise. Damage done!

Aprisium is delivering on-site-deployed detection and monitoring devices with rapid results (20-60mins) and sending live data and insights to customer browsers helping customers proactively manage and address their contamination concerns.

Job Summary:

Aprisium is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented experienced Mechatronics Engineer to join our team. As a Mechatronics Engineer, you will work closely with our CTO and chemistry team to develop, design, and test innovative mechatronic systems. You will be involved in every stage of the product development process, from research and design to manufacturing and testing.

Key Responsibilities:

• Design, model, and simulate mechatronic systems that integrate mechanical components, sensors, actuators, and control electronics for electrochemical applications.

• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define project requirements and specifications for mechatronic systems.

• Develop prototypes and conduct experiments to validate and refine designs, optimizing performance and efficiency.

• Implement control algorithms and programming logic to ensure the seamless interaction of mechanical and electrical components.

• Integrate and test sensors, actuators, and electronic components, troubleshooting and resolving any technical issues that arise.

• Conduct feasibility studies and cost analysis for new mechatronic technologies and components.

• Stay up-to-date with advancements in mechatronics, automation, and related fields to identify potential opportunities for innovation and improvement.

• Document design processes, experiments, and results thoroughly, maintaining clear and organized records.

• Ensure compliance with safety standards and best practices during all stages of mechatronic system development.

Requirements:

· Graduated with Poly, Bachelor's or Master's degree program in Mechatronics Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.

· Hands-on experience with mechatronic systems, including sensors, actuators, and control systems.

· Knowledge of mechatronic system design and development.

· Knowledge of software to develop user interfaces and ensure proper communication between hardware and software components.

· Familiarity with programming languages such as C++, Python, Rust, or Matlab.

· Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.

· Ability to work independently and as part of a high-performance team.

· Strong attention to detail and ability to follow through on tasks.

· 1+ years of work experience.

Does this sound like you, an engineer with passion for theory, innovation, and hands-on expertise in the mechatronics engineering field, please submit your application, including a cover letter and resume.

title: Software Engineer | Devices | Up to SGD$7.5k / month – J.T.
company_info: BGC Group is an international recruitment and manpower outsourcing firm that identifies and delivers human capital solutions that imperative to every successful company’s growth. description:
Roles & Responsibilities
What you’ll be doing:
Working in a team to design and develop a real-time, reliable, and secured e-payment devices that processes millions of public transport commuters’ cards daily.
Requirements gathering.
Design and develop software applications for embedded devices.
Implement and optimize communication protocols (e.g. TCP/IP, HTTPS, FTPS/SFTP, MQTT-S) to establish secure and reliable connections between embedded devices and on-premises/cloud platforms.
Conduct thorough testing, debugging, and troubleshooting of embedded devices to identify and resolve issues related to functionality, connectivity, performance, and reliability.
Preparation and submission of deliverables throughout the Software Development Lifecycles (SDLC) such as Business Rules, Software Requirement Specifications, Software Architecture Document, Design Specification, Interface Specifications, Source Codes, Testing Specification, Operation and Maintenance Manual, Training Manual and others documents as required in the SDLC processes.
Assist day-to-day application support issues.
Liaise with users on the requirement testing and production issues.
What you’ll need:
Degree in Computer Science, Computing, Electrical Engineering, or IT equivalent
Relevant experience of 4-5 years with object-oriented software development in at least one full Software Development Lifecycle.
Experience in writing Requirements Specification, Use Cases, Design Documentation, and designing software using object-oriented software design and UML modelling.
Good knowledge and experience in C++ on Embedded platforms (e.g. QNX, Vxworks, Embedded Linux).
Experience in multi-threading, socket programming and serial/USB communication.
Prior experience in following areas Scrum AGILE methodology process is a plus:
Scrum AGILE methodology process
Develop and integrate embedded devices with cloud platforms

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Good written and verbal communication skills
Self-motivated, independent and a good team player
Benefits:
AL: 14 days
ML: 14 days
Medical benefit
Completion bonus: 1 month bonus every 12 months
Interested applicants: kindly submit your resume to joelle.tam@bgc-group.com

Job Summary:

Maintenance Supervisor is in-charge of Maintenance Department including manpower planning, item purchases. Responsible for ensuring that facilities and machinery are clean and in good operating condition. Responsibilities may include overseeing and performing general maintenance and repair of the building facilities, grounds, and equipment.

Basic knowledge in PLC, an added advantage.

title: Associate Principal Robotics Software Engineer
company_info: At Dyson we are focused on solving the problems that others have ignored; solving them first using our technology and ingenuity. In order to achieve this we need to pioneer technologies that are different and authentic. This is the core of what we do and who we are. We must strive to create the future, every single day by developing new things, different things, things that go against the grain with a diverse and global team of ingenious minds. Dyson employs over 13,000 people and is present in more than 80 countries. And while we are growing fast we want Dyson to remain a start-up in spirit with the freedom of experimentation and learning, constantly reinventing our products as well as reinventing how we work, how we sell and how we support our owners. At the same time we are working through the James Dyson Foundation, James Dyson Award and Dyson Institute to inspire future engineers and pioneering a new approach to engineering education. Underlining everything we do in this diverse environment is the need to always show respect, supporting each other as one team to overcome whatever challenges we encounter. We drive empowerment, development and equality in an inclusive environment for our people around the world. The future doesn’t just happen, we look to make it happen, to achieve leaps through pioneering new ideas. This is an exciting time to join a growing company. If think your experience matches any of these roles, we should talk.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About us
Intelligent Machines (IM) Team is working on robotics and machine learning software development. You will work with a group of world-class software architects, robotics software specialists, and machine learning specialists on Dyson’s most complex products development
About the role
You'll be an experienced real-time embedded system engineer with excellent knowledge in software build/test/release process for continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD). Working in an agile cross-functional team, you will be a key member of the embedded software platform team and contribute to the development of CI/CD pipeline, sensors integration, system kernel and board bring up, and providing unified hardware abstraction layer to enable the development of more complex behaviour features in the upper application layer of edge devices.
You desire to create high quality, robust code to solve diverse real-world problems. You must be fluent in C++ and be comfortable in the whole product life cycle, including design, implementation, deployment, testing and debugging of firmware and application code.
You'll collaborate with architects, software, firmware and hardware engineers, manufacturing test engineers, and specialist engineering to help solve the wide and exciting range of AI-powered devices’ challenges posed by the ever expanding Dyson product portfolio.
Key Responsibilities
Responsible for the design, development and deployment of software build/test/release pipeline for continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) of embedded system products.
Design and develop the behavioural application running on the intelligent edge devices
Design and development of the firmware and software platforms to enable behaviours/application engineers to implement features on AI-enabled products and facilitate mass production.
Manage the entire life cycle of multiple related complex modules and systems, including the behavioural application, image build/test/release, hardware abstraction layer discussion, manufacturing test/verification methodology, documentation, design, coding, testing, maintenance, and result tracking.
Good product sense and keen focus on product performance and test automation efficiency.
Act as subject matter expert (SME) in specific domain, disseminating knowledge, guiding and mentor engineers in methodology, best practice and standards
Proactively identify technical risks within projects and influence engineering teams in their resolution
In-depth participation in cross-teams product design discussions will be required.
About You
A bachelor's degree or higher in Computer Engineer, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering Applied Mathematics, or similar.
10+ years of work experience in embedded system development, including board bring up, embedded Linux kernel/driver porting for system integration, and MCU/RTOS firmware development.
Must have industry experience in architecting software application running on embedded system.
Experience in fulfilling continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipeline setup.
Excellent knowledge and hands-on experience in Linux tool-chain, Yocto build system, version control tool (git), configuration, etc.
Experience in configuration and use of sensor devices over I2C, SPI, UART with DMA
Experience in sensors/camera/BT/Wifi modules integration and calibration is a plus.
Experience in automated testing and manufacturing test process is highly desired.
Good understanding of software development life cycles and basic electronics hardware (interface to software systems)
Excellent object oriented programming capability, including speed and overall quality; preferably, the candidate shall be able to write high performance product quality code with C++.
Familiar with STL, boost C++ libraries, design patterns and able to enforce it in day-to-day tasks.
Strong proficiency in multithreading programming and synchronisation mechanisms.
Proficient in scripting languages, such as Python and Bash.
Experience in Agile practices is a plus.
The ability to learn continuously and improve oneself.
Professionalism and excellent communication skills; ability to communicate complex information at every level.
Optimism and an excitement about collaborating with teammates and interdisciplinary teams (including hardware/firmware/system/software engineers and suppliers’ FAE), and technically support development (such as manufacturing test engineers).
For a highly experienced candidate, we expect excellent technical guidance skills and the ability to influence the work of others. Experience in over-sighting high complexity software development projects is an advantage
Independent, Integrity and self-driven with a strong focus on results to ensure that the whole team succeeds in its goals.
Fluent in spoken and written English
Benefits
Dyson Singapore monitors the market to ensure competitive salaries and bonuses. Beyond that, you’ll enjoy a transport allowance and comprehensive medical care and insurance. But financial benefits are just the start of a Dyson career. Professional growth, leadership development and new opportunities abound, driven by regular reviews and dynamic workshops. And with a vibrant culture, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to fuelling and realising ambition.

title: Backend Engineer (Machine Learning Systems), Architecture - 2024 Start
company_info: TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo. TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
TikTok will be prioritizing applicants who have a current right to work in Singapore, and do not require TikTok's sponsorship of a visa.
TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.

Why Join Us
Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.
Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.
To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.
At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.
Join us.

About the Team
Our team was established to help realize our company vision, building a global platform for creation and communication. We are doing the world-class work in machine learning, computer vision, natural language processing, speech and audio, knowledge and data mining, and transferring our work into TikTok and its affiliates' products which are used by hundreds of millions of users around the world.

As a vital AI infrastructure for the company, our machine learning system integrates our most up-to-date R&D results in AI algorithms and systems. Come and join us, you will get the chance of building large-scale machine learning systems, and working with the best AI system and algorithm researchers and engineers.

We are looking for talented individuals to join us in 2024. As a graduate, you will get unparalleled opportunities for you to kickstart your career, pursue bold ideas and explore limitless growth opportunities. Co-create a future driven by your inspiration with TikTok.
Candidates can apply to a maximum of two positions and will be considered for jobs in the order you apply. The application limit is applicable to TikTok and its affiliates' jobs globally. Applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis - we encourage you to apply early.

Responsibilities
- Architect and develop efficient, highly scalable and secured services for machine learning system
- Optimise backend systems and services for machine learning system, computational efficiency and scalability;
- Analyse business and technical requirements carefully to solve challenging problems
- Participate in design reviews and code reviews
- Collaborate with fellow engineers, product managers, and business owners in the team to ensure timely delivery of business requirements
- Research, design, and develop computer and network software or specialised utility programs.
- Analyse user needs and develop software solutions, applying principles and techniques of computer science, engineering, and mathematical analysis.
- Update software, enhances existing software capabilities, and develops and direct software testing and validation procedures.
- Work with computer hardware engineers to integrate hardware and software systems and develop specifications and performance requirements.

Qualifications
- Final year or recent graduate with a background in Software Development, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Electrical Engineering or a related technical discipline.
- Strong software programming capabilities, exhibits good code design and coding style;
- Familiarity with at least one of the programming languages: Go, Python, Java or C++;
- Pragmatic understanding of data structure, algorithm design and analysis, networking, data security, distributed system, and highly scalable systems design.

Preferred Qualifications
- Agile, quick self learner, highly self-motivated with a strong sense of product ownership and creative problem solver.
- Deeply passionate about software coding/development and building distributed system.
- Good collaborator and team player, comfortable working in a fast moving, culturally diverse and globally distributed team environment.

TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

By submitting an application for this role, you accept and agree to our global applicant privacy policy, which may be accessed here: https://careers.tiktok.com/legal/privacy.

If you have any questions, please reach out to us at apac-earlycareers@tiktok.com.

title: Electrical Engineering Professionals (Data Centres) - 1788
company_info: Annexion strives to be a premier Built Environment global headhunting consultancy and plays a key role in connecting all stakeholders in the Built Environment sector. With an international focus in Property & Real Estate, Construction & Engineering, Interior Design & Architecture, and the Built Technology sector, Annexion seeks to make an impact in the industry through connecting every stakeholder, one at a time.
job_category: Consulting, Design, Engineering, Repair and Maintenance, Others
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are currently representing a leading hyperscale data centre operator with a strong presence in Japan, and are at the forefront of technology innovation and infrastructure excellence. We are currently seeking exceptional Electrical Engineers to join our dynamic team in Singapore, with opportunities for frequent travel to Japan.The successful candidate will play a crucial role in ensuring the reliability, performance, and sustainability of our data centre facilities in Japan.

If you are successful in this role, you will have the opportunity to work with cutting-edge technology in a rapidly growing industry. You will also receive a competitive salary and benefits package. Most importantly, you will have a chance to make a meaningful impact on the digital infrastructure that powers the world.


Key Responsibilities:
- Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, implement, and maintain electrical systems for hyper-scale data centres, ensuring they meet industry standards and best practices.
- Conduct regular assessments of electrical infrastructure, identifying opportunities for optimization and efficiency improvements.
- Assist in the planning and execution of electrical infrastructure upgrades and expansions.
- Collaborate with vendors and contractors to ensure the highest quality of workmanship in all electrical projects.
- Stay up-to-date with industry trends and emerging technologies in electrical engineering for data centres.
- Act as a subject matter expert, providing guidance and mentorship to junior electrical engineers and technicians.

Key Qualifications:
- Bachelor's or Master's degree in Electrical Engineering or a related field - (7-8 years exp)
- Proven experience in electrical engineering design and maintenance for data centres, with a strong understanding of critical power systems, UPS, generators, and distribution systems is mandatory.
- Proficiency in AutoCAD, ETAP, or similar electrical design software.
- Familiarity with industry standards such as TIA-942, Uptime Institute, and NFPA.
- Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work in high-pressure situations.
- Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively in cross-functional teams.
- Willingness to travel to Japan at least 50% of the time.
- Certifications such as Professional Engineer (PE) or Certified Data Centre Professional (CDCP) are a plus.


If you are interested to find out more, apply now!

We help clients across the globe to collect, store, move and treat water and wastewater efficiently and effectively; plan and manage watersheds and harness the energy embedded in the treatment and movement of water. Binnies is proud of our more than 100-year heritage, helping clients across the globe efficiently and effectively collect, store, move and treat water and wastewater; plan and manage watersheds and harness the energy embedded in the treatment and movement of water. We are committed to creating sustainable infrastructure to meet the net-zero challenge and environmental enhancement objectives. Aligned with the UN Sustainable Development Goals we integrate sustainability into everything we do by utilising low and zero-carbon approaches and products and nature-based solutions. Through leading-edge digital transformation we strive to create more resilient, sustainable, reliable and intelligent solutions. With the use of satellite technology, artificial intelligence and data analytics, our team provides powerful and meaningful insights that lead to better investment decisions. In 2021, Binnies joined the RSK Group and today, we operate across Europe and the Asia Pacific region with offices in the UK, Singapore, Hong Kong, mainland China, Vietnam, Thailand, Malaysia, Indonesia and the Philippines. Since 1922, Binnies Singapore has been developing tailored infrastructure solutions to help meet the challenges faced by future water demands. Binnies has been involved in many iconic and award-winning projects including the Marina Barrage, SingSpring Desalination Plant, Marina East Desalination Plant, Ulu Pandan Wastewater Treatment Demonstration Plant, Integrated Waste Management Facility and the Deep Tunnel Sewerage System Phase 2. As a regional business and over the last five decades Binnies Singapore Pte Ltd has undertaken water and wastewater projects in Indonesia, the Philippines, Vietnam, Thailand, Myanmar and Malaysia.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Senior Electrical Design and Commissioning Engineer (Marine Vessel Solution)
Penjuru (Transport Pickup Provided at: Jurong East, Choa Chu Kang, Bishan & Serangoon)
Monday - Friday: 8.30am to 6.00pm
$4,000 - $6,000
Key Responsibilities:
Electrical Design:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define electrical system requirements, specifications, and design criteria for marine vessel propulsion and control systems.
Develop detailed electrical schematics, wiring diagrams, and layouts using industry-standard design tools.
Select appropriate electrical components, equipment, and materials to ensure compliance with safety, regulatory, and performance standards.
Design and implement control logic, automation, and monitoring systems for propulsion and manoeuvring.
Commissioning and Integration:
Oversee the installation, integration, and testing of electrical systems on marine vessels during construction or retrofit projects.
Conduct thorough testing, troubleshooting, and validation of electrical systems to ensure proper functionality and adherence to design specifications.
Collaborate with shipyard personnel and subcontractors to ensure proper installation and alignment of propulsion and control components.
Coordinate with project managers to establish commissioning schedules, manage resources, and ensure timely project completion.
System Optimization and Performance Enhancement:
Analyse and evaluate the performance of propulsion and control systems, identifying opportunities for optimization, efficiency improvement, and performance enhancement.
Work closely with the research and development team to implement innovative technologies and solutions to address emerging challenges in marine propulsion and control.
Documentation and Reporting:
Create comprehensive technical documentation, including operation manuals, maintenance guides, and as-built drawings for electrical systems.
Generate commissioning reports, test procedures, and status updates for internal teams, project stakeholders, and clients.
Regulatory Compliance and Safety:
Ensure that all designed and commissioned electrical systems comply with relevant maritime regulations, industry standards, and safety guidelines.
Collaborate with regulatory bodies and classification societies to obtain necessary approvals and certifications for electrical systems.
Requirements:
Diploma or Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or related field.
Proven experience (5+ years) in electrical design and commissioning, preferably in marine propulsion and control systems.
Proficiency in electrical design software (e.g., AutoCAD Electrical, EPLAN) and simulation tools.
Strong knowledge of marine electrical systems, power distribution, propulsion methods, and control strategies.
Familiarity with marine industry standards (e.g., ABS, DNV, IMO) and relevant regulations.
Willingness to travel to shipyards and vessels for commissioning activities.
Willingness to travel overseas as required.

Interested applicant may WhatsApp or Email me your latest resume for immediate arrangement.

✉ danielw.thesupreme@gmail.com

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Provide card milling and chip embedding technical support and assistance to card manufacturing customers to successfully integrate the Company’s chip products into customers’ card manufacturing process.
Work closely with internal product engineering team to classify chip embedding difficulties and identify fixes for customers’ card manufacturing processes.
Initiate discussion with product engineering team on new equipment and processes used to perform chip embedding on smart card.
Collaborate with internal teams and external vendors to define user and technical requirements and needs.
Perform feasibility studies to validate card milling and chip embedding capability and functionality.
Keep the team updated on latest materials, technologies, and equipment in the market.
Provide pre-sales technical support to business development and sales team.
Provide pre-sales and post-sales technical support to customers.
Provide technical support to suppliers and contract manufacturers.
Provide on-site customer support and will need to travel overseas to customer’s site when required.
Prepare and submit timely and accurate field reports.
Document and track technical support activities.
Coordinate and work closely with product, production, and quality team to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues expeditiously.
Coordinate and work closely with business development, sales and customer service team in addressing customer complaint, feedbacks, and queries on technical matters.
Manage program development, documentation, and resources.
Plan, organize, implement, monitor and control program or project timelines, budget, specifications and requirements, production schedules, including other performance targets for projects.
Conduct regular program status review meeting to ensure projects are on schedule.
Prepare status report on program and projects for management review.
Ensure orderly documentation and verification of all engineering, quality, material, production, and financial information for program and projects.
Collaborate with external partners in joint product development projects.
Comply with all environmental, health, safety and security policies and procedures.

JOB REQUIREMENT
Degree or Diploma in Electronic, Mechatronics, Mechanical or Electrical Engineering.
Experience in product and process engineering in secure card/ID manufacturing industry.
Familiar with card milling, embedding, lamination and card manufacturing process of secure card/ID an advantage.
At least 5 years program/project management and or technical support experience in the relevant field.
Very strong problem-solving skills and techniques, especially in applying FMEA.
Strong technical writing, analytical, and presentation skills.
Proficiency in MS Project, Excel, Words, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
Have initiative, able to function in a fast pace and pressuring work environment, a team player and a strong interest in learning and professional development.
Please email your resume to peggy.leow@smartflex.com.sg

Site Testing Engineer

Computer literacy

Positive work attitude
Team Player

title: Assistant Engineering Executive (Tuas South Incineration Plant)
company_info: The National Environment Agency (NEA) is the leading public organisation responsible for ensuring a clean and sustainable environment for Singapore. Its key roles are to improve and sustain a clean environment, promote sustainability and resource efficiency, maintain high public health standards, provide timely and reliable meteorological information, and encourage a vibrant hawker culture. NEA works closely with its partners and the community to develop and spearhead environmental and public health initiatives and programmes. It is committed to motivating every individual to care for the environment as a way of life, in order to build a liveable and sustainable Singapore for present and future generations. For more information, visit www.nea.gov.sg
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
What the role is
You will work in Tuas South Incineration Plant as Assistant Engineering Executive (equivalent to technician level) to ensure safe and effective operation and maintenance of the electrical equipment and systems in the incineration plant.
What you will be working on
You will be responsible for the following:
Attend to daily preventive maintenance of assigned plant electrical, instrumentation and control equipment.
Attend to daily job cards assignments of unscheduled outages of plant electrical, instrumentation and control equipment.
Attend to overhauling of equipment/system as assigned by the Supervisors.
Supervise the work of contractors.
Assist the Executive Engineering Manager/Engineering Executive in carrying out preventive and remedial maintenance of plant electrical, instrumentation and control equipment.
Carry out any works that will help to ensure and maintain the high availability of the plant electrical, instrumentation and control equipment.
What we are looking for
NITEC in Electrical Engineering/Electrical Technology (Power & Control)/Mechatronics Engineering
Working experience (1 to 3 years) in operation and maintenance is preferable. Candidates with no working experience are welcome to apply
Must be computer literate
Able to work independently
A good team player with strong interpersonal skills
Able to perform occasional night duties
Able and willing to work on weekend and after office hours
As part of the shortlisting process for this role, you may be required to complete a medical declaration and/or undergo further assessment.
To apply, please proceed to https://sggovterp.wd102.myworkdayjobs.com/PublicServiceCareers/job/NEA-TUAS-SOUTH-INCINERATION-PLANT-TSIP/Assistant-Engineering-Executive--Tuas-South-Incineration-Plant-_JR-10000020570

title: Mobile Applications Software Engineer
company_info: No information added.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
We are the global leader in high-performance private wireless systems. We build cutting-edge mesh networks for robotics, drones, and the Industrial Internet of Things. We have experienced rapid growth over the past five years as our radio systems have been adopted by Fortune 500 companies (example: Airbus, General Electric) and industry-leading innovators (example: Boston Dynamics, FLIR).
We’re looking for an experienced Mobile App Developer to join our talented team of software, hardware and RF engineers. The candidate will be responsible for designing and implementing cross platform apps such as Android/iOS to manage the wireless routers. They should be a solid contributor and able to design, develop, code, test, and debug as well. They must be able to write clean/optimized code and push the capabilities of our Smart Radio.

Core skills:
Familiar with Flutter.
Familiar with iOS native languages Swift/Objective-C programming.
Familiar with Android native languages Java/Kotlin programming.
Good knowledge in iOS and Android SDK.
Familiarity in wireless router communication interface such as LuCi, SSH etc
Familiarity and use of backend technologies and APIs (such as RPC) to integrate into mobile applications.
Familiarity and use of native mobile IDE tools such as XCode and Android Studio.
Familiarity with App Store submission process.
Experience with version control systems Git.

Additional skills:
Knowledge in Oracle PL/SQL is a plus
Knowledge in Linux commands is a plus
Knowledge in ReactJS or React Native is a plus
Scripting with Bash shell, Python is a plus
Knowledge of mobile Apps development process is a plus
Knowledge of mobile UI/UX design principles and guidelines (such as Apple's Human Interface Guidelines) is a plus

Requirements:
Candidate must possess at least a bachelor’s degree, Post Graduate Diploma or Professional Degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science or equivalent.
At least 4 year working experience developing and launching mobile applications for Android and iOS.
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment.
Strong communication skills and ability to engage with a cross-functional team.
Hardworking, Smart working, committed, and fast learner in tight deadline environment

title: Manufacturing Engineer - Cabinet Specialist
company_info: NES GLOBAL PTE. LTD. EA License Number: 08C4291
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Role Summary:
As a Cabinet Specialist you will take ownership for the Cabinet and Design process. You will provide support to cross-functional teams on a variety of projects that will require your knowledge and contribution. Using your knowledge of the Cabinet design and conformance to Specification & Standards such as API, IEC NEMA. You will be executing projects across the regions ensuring project conformance to Technical Regulations and Standards and deliver the Design Cabinet Output with successful completion delivery to delight our customers and to ensure quality is met.

Essential Responsibilities:
As a Cabinet Design Specialist/Technician, you will be responsible for:
• Primarily responsibility is to create electrical control cabinet design with all necessary documentation according to industry and customer requirements.
• Participate in R3 Handover process, Understand Customer RFQ Design Specification, Compliance to customer specifications for Hardware / Cabinets
• Using Eplan, AUTOCAD, MicroStation software to create and revise Project Drawings (System Layout and wiring, Loop drawings)
• Supporting manufacturing related technical questions and independently lead part SAP Creation and Cabinet designing.
• Ensuring expected results in term of quality, execution time, and cost (within control).
• Recommending new design enhancements or modifications to achieve project objectives.
• Supporting Pre-FAT and FAT pre-works and setup, Cabinet pre-inspection, inspection, and activities to ensure quality technical implementation to meet customer design requirements.
• Work closely with internal team such as project engineer, Cabinet engineer and Project management in a cross-functional environment.

Desired Characteristics:
• Have good written and spoken English, with demonstrated capability to structure and write technical material.
• Have prior experience in global project execution and proficient with document layout, formatting, and editing.
• Demonstrate excellent communication skills and an ability to build trusting relationships with customers and suppliers.
• Demonstrate the ability to quickly learn new products and business areas
• Be a self-starter with minimal supervision requirements, proactively taking the initiative to solving problems and ability to work independently and meet deadlines.
• Show an analytical approach to problem-solving and be motivated and focused on results.
• Possess Team Player, ability to organize and plan effectively with an Analytical mindset.
• Mechanical, Electrical engineering or having experience in engineering field are welcome.
• Working with international suppliers
• Knowledge of Bently Nevada machinery protection and management systems products and services will be an advantage preferred.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Audio Visual Service Engineer
Working days: Monday - Friday
Working hours: 9am - 6pm
Salary range: $2800 - $4000
Location: 2Kallang Bahru (Near Bendemeer MRT)

The Audio Visual Service Engineer will be responsible for providing technical support for audio visual equipment in a variety of settings, including corporate offices, educational institutions, government agencies, and public venues. Candidate will work with clients to troubleshoot and resolve technical issues related to audio visual equipment, including projectors, video walls, digital signage, and video conferencing systems. The role will require extensive knowledge of audio visual equipment, as well as excellent communication and customer service skills.
Key Responsibilities:
Install, configure, and troubleshoot audio visual equipment such as projectors, video walls, digital signage, and video conferencing systems.
Work with clients to diagnose and resolve technical issues related to audio visual equipment.
Provide on-site technical support for events and presentations, including set-up and breakdown of equipment.
Train clients on the proper use and maintenance of audio visual equipment.
Maintain an inventory of audio visual equipment and ensure that all equipment is in good working condition.
Perform preventive maintenance on audio visual equipment to minimize downtime and extend the life of the equipment.
Stay up-to-date on new audio visual technologies and products and recommend upgrades or improvements to existing systems.
Provide excellent customer service and maintain positive relationships with clients.
Qualifications:
Possess with electrical engineering, computer science, or related education background.
Experience in audio visual engineering or a related field.
Extensive knowledge of audio visual equipment, including projectors, video walls, digital signage, and video conferencing systems.
Experience with troubleshooting technical issues related to audio visual equipment.
Willingness to work flexible hours and be available for on-call support.
Knowledge of networking and IT infrastructure is a plus.

The Audio Visual Project Engineer will be responsible for overseeing the design, installation, and maintenance of audio visual systems for various projects. The Engineer will work closely with project managers, technicians, and clients to ensure that all audio visual systems are implemented to meet project requirements and specifications. The Engineer will also be responsible for testing and troubleshooting audio visual systems, as well as providing technical support to clients as needed.

Work with technicians to schedule and perform regular system maintenance, including firmware updates, software upgrades, and hardware replacements.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends, technologies, and best practices for audio visual system design and installation.
Brief project updates and status to project managers and clients as needed.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About SLB:
We are SLB, the leading provider of technology and services to the energy industry. Throughout much of the oil and gas lifecycle in over 120 countries; we design, develop and deliver technology and services that transforms how work is done. We define the boundaries of the industry by unleashing our talented people’s energy. We are looking for innovators to join our diverse community of colleagues and develop new solutions and push the limits of what is possible. If you share our passion for discovery and want to find out what you could really do, then here is the place to do it.

Manufacturing Engineer (Electrical/ Automation/ Project Management/ Troubleshooting)
Location: Benoi
Company Transport Provided (Boon Lay)
Salary from $4500 - $7000 depending on experience
AWS + VB

Job Summary:
Performs the lead role in the design and implementation of manufacturing processes, standards, and techniques.
Key interface between Engineering and Production and will typically be an expert in areas such as electrical and mechanical assemblies, test procedures, and process planning, to improve existing manufacturing processes.
Responsible for solving manufacturing or assembly problems and takes an active role in troubleshooting quality and production yield-related issues within manufacturing.

Responsibilities and Duties:
Responsible for the implementation of key elements of Lean & Six Sigma, such as standardized work instructions, work sequence (routing) optimization, Value Stream Mapping, Kaizen/5S activities, pull processes, etc.
Takes the lead in managing the deliverables of third parties by setting project timeframes, identifying problems, and assuring product quality.
Responsible for providing bi-weekly production order status and risks to the management team.
Creates, implements, and monitors key performance indicators for manufacturing process capability and product quality assurance.
Responsible for assisting in investigations, performing root cause analysis, and identifying corrective actions tied to manufacturing quality issues.
Review and sign off on Engineering Change Orders that impact the product life cycle, e.g., Obsolescence, etc.
Implement engineering specifications into processes and provide shop feedback to capture manufacturability and assembly issues for existing and future designs.
Responsible for identifying opportunities and driving continuous improvement projects on manufacturing processes to reduce waste, lead time, and cost.
Implement process improvements to achieve manufacturing excellence in areas like cycle time reduction, productivity, and process yield (e.g., First Pass Yield, Rolled Throughput Yield).

Requirements:
Bachelor's or Master's: Electrical, Electronics, Manufacturing, or Mechatronics Engineering.
Knowledge of the assembly and testing phases of the electrical and mechanical manufacturing lifecycle.
Knowledge of instrumentation and control systems is ideal
Knowledge of LEAN Six Sigma techniques and metrics.
Exposure and experience in Hazardous area installations (IEC 60079).

Apple Lim Pey Chyi – Apple.lim@manpower.com.sg
Personnel Reg No: R2090579
EA Licence No: 02C3423

title: Senior Mechatronics Design and Commissioning Engineer
company_info: Sea Forrest is a professional service company incorporated in Singapore in 2011 with a team professional staff comprising of a mixture of young, dynamic and experienced professionals. Sea Forrest has its key competency in project management, our project management personnel are experienced, with relevant backgrounds in the fields of the offshore design, construction, afloat repair and integration and commissioning of offshore vessel forms, especially for Jack-Ups, Semi-Submersibles, Floatels, pipe lay vessels, FPSO, tender rigs and fixed platforms. Sea Forrest has embarked on its Electrification journey in the development of systems integration capabilities and testing facilities whereby Energy Storage Systems, Power Drive Trains and Energy Management Systems are interfaced with vessel designs to derive optimal performance in energy savings and emission reduction.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Position Overview:
We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Mechatronics Design and Commissioning Engineer with a strong mechanical background in mechanical structures, engines, generators, hydraulics, and related systems to join our dynamic team. Your expertise will be instrumental in the design, development, and commissioning of advanced green propulsion and energy management systems for marine vessels. As a key member of our engineering team, you will play a crucial role in enhancing the efficiency, performance, and sustainability of marine propulsion systems.

Responsibilities:
1) System Design and Integration:
· Collaborate with cross-functional teams to conceptualize, design, and develop mechanical, electrical and electronic control systems for marine vessel propulsion and energy management.
· Leverage your strong mechanical knowledge to ensure seamless integration of mechanical, electrical, and control components.
2) Control System Development:
· Design, develop, and implement control algorithms for propulsion systems, energy storage, and power distribution, integrating your understanding of mechanical components for optimal performance.
3) System Specification and procurement:
· Utilize your mechanical expertise to evaluate and select appropriate components, sensors, actuators, and other mechatronic elements that align with mechanical requirements.
· Prepare technical specifications including mechanical drawings for system and requirements for components and oversee procurement processes.
· Manage external and internal parties to ensure timely delivery of required systems.
4) Prototyping and Testing:
· Build and oversee the construction of prototypes and test setups, leveraging your mechanical knowledge to ensure accurate representation of mechanical systems.
· Conduct thorough testing, data collection, and analysis to verify system functionality and performance under various operating conditions.
5) Commissioning and Integration:
· Lead the commissioning and integration of green propulsion and energy management systems on marine vessels, utilizing your mechanical insight to ensure mechanical components' proper functionality.
· Provide technical support and training to vessel crews during commissioning.
6) Troubleshooting and Maintenance:
· Utilize your strong mechanical background to diagnose and resolve complex mechatronic and mechanical system issues during commissioning and operations.
· Develop maintenance strategies, emphasizing mechanical aspects, to ensure long-term system reliability.
7) Documentation and Reporting:
· Maintain accurate documentation throughout the design, development, commissioning, and maintenance phases, incorporating mechanical details.
· Prepare technical reports, progress updates, and performance evaluations for stakeholders.
8) Innovation and Continuous Improvement:
· Stay updated with industry trends and emerging technologies, especially those related to mechanical components and systems.
· Contribute to the improvement of design methodologies, processes, and best practices.

Qualifications:
· Diploma or Bachelor's degree in Mechatronics, Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, or a related field.
· Proven experience (3+ years) in designing, developing, and commissioning vessel propulsion or electrical systems, with a strong mechanical understanding of engines, generators, hydraulics, etc.
· Solid mechanical knowledge to ensure successful integration of mechanical components.
· Proficiency in control systems, automation, and integration of mechanical and electrical components.
· Familiarity with marine vessel systems, regulations, and operational considerations is highly advantageous.
· Hands on experience with CAD software for mechanical design and 3D modelling.
· Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex mechatronic and mechanical issues.
· Strong communication skills to collaborate with cross-functional teams and convey technical concepts effectively.
· Adaptability and a proactive approach to learning and implementing new technologies.
· Positive and with a can do attitude.

title: Sensing Hardware Development Engineer - Electrical
company_info: APPLE SOUTH ASIA PTE. LTD.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Job Summary
Imagine what you could do here. At Apple, new ideas have a way of becoming phenomenal products, services, and customer experiences very quickly. Bring passion and dedication to your job and there's no telling what you could accomplish! The success we are striving will be the result of very skilled people working in an environment which cultivates creativity, partnership, and thinking of old problems in new ways. If that sounds like the kind of environment that you find intriguing, then let's talk! We design, develop, and launch next-generation Sensor Technologies in Apple products. The Sensor Hardware team develops sensor solutions and technologies for a variety of Apple products such as iPhones, iPads, and Macs. The key goal of the Sensor Technology team is to enable the world’s best user-experience. New challenges arise every day that require the sharp problem-solving skills of hardworking and experienced individuals. Are you in for these challenges? The team features a collaborative and hands-on environment that fosters engineering excellence, creativity, and innovation. We are looking for Hardware Development Engineer with strong background in electrical design, characterization, data analysis, and system-level troubleshooting to help develop new optical sensors and sensing systems for future Apple products. Join us in crafting solutions the world doesn't know of yet.
Key Qualifications
Multi-disciplinary understanding of electronics, basic optics, and general physics principles.
Strong electrical engineering background in analog and mixed-signal system-level circuit design, especially board-level circuit
Good knowledge of inter-module communications protocols (I2C, SPI, etc.)
Hand on experience in hardware and circuit validation using lab measurement equipment (oscilloscope, analyzers, etc).
Proficiency in scripting for modelling, automation, data acquisition, and data analysis (Matlab, Python, etc)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and solid teamwork and leadership skills.
Experience with production data statistical analysis and optical sensor systems mass production is a plus
Description
Identify, implement, and document new optical sensing system metrics and specifications to deliver performance that matter to customer experience.
Build lab bench and measurement automations to support design validation and characterization across all development phases.
Analyze engineering and production data sets to validate system performance and design maturity.
Lead failure analysis of optical modules and system integrations, driving corrective actions with cross-functional teams and suppliers.
Author regular technical communications for executive and cross-functional briefings.
Scope new optical sensing technologies and proof-of-concept investigations.
Business travel to support product development and supplier teams as necessary.
Education
Degree in Electrical Engineering, Optics, or Physics. M.S/PhD, or B.S. with proven hardware development experience.

The Sensor Hardware team develops sensor solutions and technologies for a variety of Apple products such as iPhones, iPads, and Macs. The key goal of the Sensor Technology team is to enable the world’s best user-experience. New challenges arise every day that require the sharp problem-solving skills of hardworking and experienced individuals. Are you in for these challenges? The team features a collaborative and hands-on environment that fosters engineering excellence, creativity, and innovation. We are looking for Hardware Development Engineer with strong background in electrical design, characterization, data analysis, and system-level troubleshooting to help develop new optical sensors and sensing systems for future Apple products. Join us in crafting solutions the world doesn't know of yet.
Key Qualifications
Multi-disciplinary understanding of electronics, basic optics, and general physics principles.
Strong electrical engineering background in analog and mixed-signal system-level circuit design, especially board-level circuit
Good knowledge of inter-module communications protocols (I2C, SPI, etc.)
Hand on experience in hardware and circuit validation using lab measurement equipment (oscilloscope, analyzers, etc).
Proficiency in scripting for modelling, automation, data acquisition, and data analysis (Matlab, Python, etc)
Excellent written and verbal communication skills, and solid teamwork and leadership skills.
Experience with production data statistical analysis and optical sensor systems mass production is a plus
Description
Identify, implement, and document new optical sensing system metrics and specifications to deliver performance that matter to customer experience.
Build lab bench and measurement automations to support design validation and characterization across all development phases.
Analyze engineering and production data sets to validate system performance and design maturity.
Lead failure analysis of optical modules and system integrations, driving corrective actions with cross-functional teams and suppliers.
Author regular technical communications for executive and cross-functional briefings.
Scope new optical sensing technologies and proof-of-concept investigations.
Business travel to support product development and supplier teams as necessary.
Education
Degree in Electrical Engineering, Optics, or Physics. M.S/PhD, or B.S. with proven hardware development experience.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Candidate Profile
The ideal candidate will have significant experience working on although not limited to: scheduling, workface planning, coordinating, supervising and ensuring the safety, consistent and fair application of all policies and procedures.

title: (Senior) Facility & Electrical Engineer
company_info: NatSteel traces its lineage to 1961, when it was incorporated as National Iron and Steel Mills. A pioneer and key partner in Singapore’s nation building efforts, our products are used in most construction projects island-wide, from the iconic Changi International Airport to the public housing that is the trademark of Singapore’s landscape. Singapore is home to NatSteel’s headquarters as well as its flagship plant, which boasts one of the largest single downstream rebar fabrication operations in the world. The Singapore plant is the only local steel mill with an integrated upstream and downstream operation, where steel is manufactured through recycling scrap, and fabricated according to customers’ needs.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
Senior Electrical Design and Commissioning Engineer (Marine Vessel Solution)
Penjuru (Transport Pickup Provided at: Jurong East, Choa Chu Kang, Bishan & Serangoon)
Monday - Friday: 8.30am to 6.00pm
$4,000 - $6,000
Key Responsibilities:
Electrical Design:
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to define electrical system requirements, specifications, and design criteria for marine vessel propulsion and control systems.
Develop detailed electrical schematics, wiring diagrams, and layouts using industry-standard design tools.
Select appropriate electrical components, equipment, and materials to ensure compliance with safety, regulatory, and performance standards.
Design and implement control logic, automation, and monitoring systems for propulsion and manoeuvring.
Commissioning and Integration:
Oversee the installation, integration, and testing of electrical systems on marine vessels during construction or retrofit projects.
Conduct thorough testing, troubleshooting, and validation of electrical systems to ensure proper functionality and adherence to design specifications.
Collaborate with shipyard personnel and subcontractors to ensure proper installation and alignment of propulsion and control components.
Coordinate with project managers to establish commissioning schedules, manage resources, and ensure timely project completion.
System Optimization and Performance Enhancement:
Analyse and evaluate the performance of propulsion and control systems, identifying opportunities for optimization, efficiency improvement, and performance enhancement.
Work closely with the research and development team to implement innovative technologies and solutions to address emerging challenges in marine propulsion and control.
Documentation and Reporting:
Create comprehensive technical documentation, including operation manuals, maintenance guides, and as-built drawings for electrical systems.
Generate commissioning reports, test procedures, and status updates for internal teams, project stakeholders, and clients.
Regulatory Compliance and Safety:
Ensure that all designed and commissioned electrical systems comply with relevant maritime regulations, industry standards, and safety guidelines.
Collaborate with regulatory bodies and classification societies to obtain necessary approvals and certifications for electrical systems.
Requirements:
Diploma or Bachelor's degree in Electrical Engineering or related field.
Proven experience (5+ years) in electrical design and commissioning, preferably in marine propulsion and control systems.
Proficiency in electrical design software (e.g., AutoCAD Electrical, EPLAN) and simulation tools.
Strong knowledge of marine electrical systems, power distribution, propulsion methods, and control strategies.
Familiarity with marine industry standards (e.g., ABS, DNV, IMO) and relevant regulations.
Willingness to travel to shipyards and vessels for commissioning activities.
Willingness to travel overseas as required.

Interested applicants kindly click on the “Apply Now” button or whatsapp text your resume to allow our Consultant to match you with our Clients. No Charges will be incurred by Candidates for any service rendered.

description:
Roles & Responsibilities
About The Role
The is a dual trade role which is a critical position within the operations team being established which focused on delivery from Execute phase, culminating in a successful Start-up and CRUX Project to Asset handover through to operations. This position is a key role that moves through the Project phase into the future organisation operations structure to maintain Crux. A major part of the role will also be to train and mentor future staff to facilitate interventions on Crux from Prelude.

POSITION DESCRIPTION - ACCOUNTABILITIES
Roles and responsibilities will differ between the different phases of the Project Cycle leading up to operations.
IN THE EXECUTE PHASE:
- Work with the Training department to set up competence and training requirements.
- Contribute to and review any Project Engineering activities that requires your support.
- Contribute to the Operations and Maintenance workshops.
- Review and contribute to maintenance work pack development
- Review and contribute to the Computerised Maintenance Management System build.
- Support and build a compile Corrective Maintenance work packs for critical equipment.

FOR ONSHORE COMMISSIONING/FABRICTION YARD
- Gain knowledge on the asset by walkdowns on the asset.
- Review of Work packs to ensure that they are fit for purpose.
- Work with the CSU team for commissioning of equipment thereby gaining knowledge.
- Attend vendor specific training for different equipment
- Support and contribute to handover walkdowns for commissioned systems
- Support CSU team with Preservation and structured walkdowns to ensure equipment and piping are maintains cleanliness.
- Review of permits and isolations to ensure they are fit for purpose.
- Work with Training department to build training packages for new starters from respective knowledge gain through vendor and equipment training.

OPERATIONS:
- Provide assurance and oversight of execution of maintenance scope through the maintenance contractors. Responsibilities include the undertaking of offshore operations surveillance tasks and minor maintenance including sampling and testing. Other activities include safe isolation and purging of plant and equipment ensuring a Safe Work environment to execute the work scopes inclusive of the relevant steps to bring back the plant or equipment into service.

Experience Requirements:
Dual Trade Instrument / Electrical Certificate with A Grade Western Australian Electrical License
Sound technical understanding and experience in various Instrumentation and Electrical systems, with a preference to have a minimum of ten years working in an INLEC role.
Sound understanding of work preparation and scheduling requirements.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Experience in mentoring, training, leading, and working within teams and engagement with other disciplines.
Proficient in coordinating maintenance activities on oil & gas facilities through a computerised maintenance management system (CMMS).
Understanding of business processes for maintenance
Maintain flexibility with an ability to perform autonomously in a dynamic work environment
Experience with analysers with respect to servicing, calibrating, repairing, and troubleshooting.
What You Need
INLEC Dual Trade Certificate (preferred) or Electrician with Instrumentation certification
Endorsed Electrical Fitter / Mechanic or Electrician’s License
10 years experience

title: Sales Engineer
company_info: Ingersoll Rand is a global market leader with a broad range of innovative and mission-critical air, fluid, energy, specialty vehicle and medical technologies, providing services and solutions to increase industrial productivity and efficiency. Since merging with Gardner Denver in early 2020, we have more than 300 years of combined experience and innovative expertise.
description:
Roles & Responsibilities
The Sales Engineer is accountable to generate profitable air compressors and dryers sales revenue and increase operating income by broadening sales coverage, establishing new accounts, and providing total solutions to customers. To maintain close relationship with the customers in assigned industries.

Responsibilities:
Achieve sales target set for area of responsibilities.
Negotiation on tender, contract terms and condition and preparation of Sales contract.
Visit and meet prospective customers in assigned industries to provide required services and solicit for orders.
Prepare sales report, analyzing cost and sales, quotations and maintaining and creating new client accounts.
Provide pre-sales technical assistance, product training and after-sales support.
Prepare demonstration and technical presentations to customer.
Attending trade shows, conferences, marketing, and other events.
Work closely with supply chain management, sales support and project engineer and order fulfillment team.
Qualifications/Requirements:
Diploma/Degree in Mechanical/Electrical Engineering.
Minimum 3 years sales experience selling industrial products.
Product knowledge of air compressor & control system will be advantageous.
Strong team player who is self-motivated and customer oriented.
Work independently, process good communication and strong presentation skills.
Understanding of financial metrics including margin, revenue, overhead costs, Profit and Loss, and Project Financials.
Excellent communications/human relations skills (written, verbal, client service).
Possess own vehicle (preferred)
